Reviews.Title: “Love embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when arriving at lax and on the night before our return trip. Love everything about embassy suites except they charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: P C
Reviews.Content: Rooms were well equipped including free WiFi and a door that closes between bedroom and sitting room. Beds were just average, but adequate. Patio door opened allowing extra ventilation. Breakfast included fresh-made omelets, cereals, oat meal and pastries. Had to walk to the Marriott across the street to get a latte at their Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlleyB
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised during my overnight here between flights from LAX. The rooms are extremely spacious suites, very clean, and very quiet (particularly for being located so close to the airport). The free breakfast was just ok, but, well, it was free and convenient. A free shuttle to/from the airport rounds out the convenience offered. I would certainly choose this hotel again during a layover.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jomar75
Reviews.Content: i took my family which was 18 total, to los angeles and stayed here for two days before my 50th anniversary cruise to the mexican riviera on carnival. everyone from our smallest member of the family to the oldest had a great time. the hotel was close to the air port but not so that it was annoying. the hotel rooms were clean and the service was good also. the convient shuttle to the hotel was free. it was a good place because it was close to the site seeing of los angeles. of course we all enjoyed the included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel average, but complicit in restaurant rip off”
Reviews.Author: Familytravel12
Reviews.Content: The check in staff (Sparkle and another gentleman) were friendly and terrific, however we had such a poor experience with the hotel restaurant that it ruined our opinion of the hotel completely. We ordered "Food to go" from the menu in the room (from the restaurant in the hotel), which listed salmon at $14. When I went to pick it up, they charged $18 for it. When I told the restaurant employee that it was listed in the menu in the room for $14, he spoke to his manager and after a really long time, returned and told me that his manager said that I must be mistaken (the manager didn't even bother coming to talk to me). I then went all the way back to my room, retrieved the menu and brought it back to the restaurant to show them. After another long wait, the employee did the right thing, apologized and charged $14 for it, since his manager was too busy and the food was getting cold. In the morning, we awoke to an adjusted bill for $1 (yes, $1 only) for a service fee for the salmon. So not only did the restaurant try to overcharge me initially, and then I had to go back and forth to prove that the restaurant was charging more than the advertised price, but then someone went to the trouble of getting the hotel to administer a bill for $1 for a service fee. I think this was the restaurant manager's idea of an insult, and it's a terrible example of customer service. This was the worst, but other things that tripadvisor customers may be interested in is knowing that while there is a separate bedroom (separated by a door) to the living room, which is great for families, the pull-out couch in the living room is awful to sleep on and feels like sleeping on springs with no cushioning. Being near LAX is a plus, but the walls/ windows are poorly insulated and the noise from the airplanes is very loud. Finally, and perhaps this is standard in Hilton hotels, but when you arrive there are two bottles of water, a bag of pretzels and a couple of chocolate bars on the table. It is a wonderful surprise, but then there is also a page that is completely incomprehensible talking about Hilton Rewards points and that you need a certain amount of points in order to consume the food and water and it seems to indicate that if you eat the food and don't have the points you'll be charged, but it does not state it clearly. We didn't eat the food, but it was quite a disappointment to first see the goodies and then see that perhaps it was not complimentary. It seems like an underhanded ploy for the hotel to add charges to the room. In short, we probably won't be staying at this hotel or any Embassy Suites because of the awful experience with the hotel's restaurant and the hotel adding a charge after the restaurant greatly inconvenienced us.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a super-expensive city!”
Reviews.Author: eRev82
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this is a great hotel for the value. Â The rooms are super spacious and modern -- especially for the airport strip. There are two rooms: the living and the sleep area; and both have televisions and ample seating space. The living room has a sofa that folds out into a bed, a chair and a pseudo conference table that has three seats. There is also a mini-bar station with a sink and a refrigerator. The parking is not free; however, we knew that before we checked in and before we even made it into the city, as I'm sure most people did, as well; so, I'm not really sure what all the fuss is about. Wi-Fi is also NOT free, which is kind of ridiculous. I think Internet access should be free everywhere. Gotta love those ancillary services. :-| I would definitely recommend activating your mobile hotspot through your wireless carrier for the duration of your stay. It's cheaper and it will probably work for your connectivity needs as long as you're not streaming an abundance of music and movies. The breakfast is free and hot and FREE. Nothing tastes better than free. Enough said. If you can, request a room away from the elevator so you don't have to hear people coming and going at all times of the night. We were facing south and we had a nice view of the city traffic and the airport on the distance. It was actually nice to see the planes take-off and come in and not be able to hear them. All in all, this location is a great choice for your LA stay if you need to or want to stay close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: AlanBachrach
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here so that we could grab breakfast and then fly out of LAX. I have only good things to say. The staff was terrific. The service was excellent. The breakfast buffet was a bit crowded on Sunday morning and pretty basic, but had nice variety and was served in a comfortable setting. The room was reasonably quiet (given the amount of noise from traffic) and nicely appointed. The beds were comfortable and everything was clean. The bathroom was spacious. Everything worked as it was supposed to. Parking is limited (or you can pay for the garage), but the bellman assisted us by taking our bags to the room while we returned the car to Alamo (and Alamo has a van and driver specifically to take people back to their hotels.). In all, the experience was excellent and I plan to use this as my primary hotel when flying out of L.A. (and would also consider using it while staying in L.A.)

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Embassy Suites Standard”
Reviews.Author: siva2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the LAX Embassy Suites as we arrived at 9pm LA time, midnight east coast time. We selected the Embassy Suites because with the time change, we find a suite helpful. However, our room might as well not have been a suite. The sink was positioned so that using it required lighting up the bedroom, just what we wanted to avoid. I think this might have been a handicapped access room which was the reason. We noticed this when we arrived, but did not want to start changing rooms at that hour. However, an hour later, we discovered the toilet functioned sporadically. (My husband investigated and discovered it was missing a piece inside.) Again, at 1am our time, we didn't want to change rooms and made do. However, we shouldn't have had to! I definitely felt that I should have been warned about this room as we do not require handicapped access, and it was very inconvenient for a couple. On a less important note, check-in was a bit odd. The person checking us in made some unusual remarks about our clothes. These were compliments, but a bit off. (At first we thought that this was just easterners response to California manners, but didn't experience this anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Personnel”
Reviews.Author: Kapaluacat29220
Reviews.Content: We arrived early Sunday morning after a long flight from Singapore. Jesus at the front desk was awesome in assisting us with an early check in so we could clean up and go to our granddaughter's 20th birthday party. 3rd time we've stayed here and will certainy do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: ljw1262
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two weeks in LA for work and stayed at the Embassy Suites. I had a king suite that was wonderful, more like a small apartment. Hotel staff were very friendly, free breakfast was suitable, as was the fitness room. Very close to LAX but convenient to Manhattan Beach if you have a car. Not much within walking distance other than a starbucks inside the Marriott across the street. Room was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel very close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Natalia M
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, it has a rather unique style to it. It's located within minutes from the airport and it offers a free shuttle to and from the airport. If you plan on taking the shuttle, make sure to call and let them know which terminal you are waiting at (we weren't aware of that so we had to wait a bit until we decided to give them a call). Staff is very friendly and helpful. I haven't paid much attention to the exterior of the hotel, but inside it's gorgeous. Lots of real plants and fish swimming in the water. I hear there is breakfast but we didn't get the chance to try it. In the evenings, they sometimes offer free drinks (alcoholic and nonalcoholic) and snacks. We got there towards the end of the event so most of the stuff was gone but we did get nachos with cheese and salsa and there was also a popcorn machine. We had dinner in the restaurant and the food was overpriced (just like in all hotels) and it was of average taste. Although we haven't used it, I liked the fact that there was a mini-kitchen. There were tv's both in the living room and the bedroom. There is plenty of storage space in case you are staying for a longer period of time. Bed is comfy and bathroom is clean. There are no real walls when you enter your room, it's sort of a glass-made wall so it's somewhat noisy. I was wondering if this would create problems when sleeping but it didn't since there is a door to the bedroom which prevents all the noise from coming in. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but design carries the sound”
Reviews.Author: BostonComputerChic
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after a late flight in from the East coast. First the positives. 1. Great LAX shuttle! We were a party of 8. The first shuttle was too full for us, we turned around and a second empty shuttle was right behind. Quick and easy. 2. Check in, plesant and efficient. We were in our rooms in no time. 3. Big room. The "Master" suite is a separate room with lots of space. 4. GREAT Free breakfast. Lots of verity, omelet station. 5. Next door to budget rent a car. We didn't know this and were pleasantly surprised to be able to walk across the street to pick up our rental in the morning. Negatives, 1. The design is one of those open atrium in the middle, sound travels up, models. Lovely to look at but someone was having a party in the lobby which carried up to the kids trying to sleep in the pull out couch in the living room. Us, parents in the bedroom got a great nights sleep behind heavy bedroom doors. 2. There were a bunch of pretzel crumbs in the pull out couch when we pulled it out. Weird...and annoying. 3. Elevators were s-l-o-w. But I think there may have been fellow young guests causing breakdowns the same day. I'd lean more towards a 4.5, over a 4. All in all a great nights stay, if we were sticking around town longer I would have been happy to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: calvinpoway
Reviews.Content: This past weekend we stayed at Embassy Suites. I have decided due to the amount of other hotels in the area we won't be returning. The hotel has good points- the two rooms and it ends at about that. This is the second time staying here that an elevator quit working-even if they are all working they are the slowest in town. The keys did not work twice to our rooms and no they were not next to cell phones or credit cards. The food area is a disaster-kind of dirty and really unorganized. The lighting in the bathroom (generally the whole room) is so bad you have to sit next to a floor length mirror in the bedroom to apply makeup. We were also put on the second floor which is very loud beginning at 6 in the am. We thought we would give this hotel another chance but not again. It needs some major overhauling and in general clean up of the entire hotel. Parking is very expensive as well and come on people shouldn't there be free wireless?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay If You Are At LAX”
Reviews.Author: nvboatman
Reviews.Content: We recently had to stay at Embassy Suites LAX North after our flight got in too late to catch a connecting flight. Aftering making it through the maze of LAX, we got our hotel shuttle bus which went about 150 yards and died. Another bus showed up in about 15 minutes, and we were away to the hotel. Upon our arrival, the desk clerk automatically gave us 15% off from either the restaurant or room service because of the shuttle problem. The room was nice and quiet and the room service wa prompt. The breakfast the next day was fine, but I have eaten at other Embassy Suites where there was much more "creativity" in their breakfast meals. The shuttle back to the airport was running behind schedule in the morning, so I am glad that we left earlier than planned.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not much else”
Reviews.Author: bigdog_tboo
Reviews.Content: As a family of 6 we stayed here in April 2011. We overnighted here on the way to Mexico as it was close to the airport. Very tired and rundown hotel in desperate need of a makeover. We love Embassy Suites as they are usually relaxed and family friendly. My wife and I went down for the happy hour. The woman serving the drinks suggested that I was drinking too much after I order our 3rd round!?!? Cheeky and rude bugger! The area around the hotel was old and tired too. Closest shops are a 15minute walk away. Conventient to the airport and thats it.

Reviews.Title: “Overnighter for an early flight”
Reviews.Author: TravelMonkeyCalgary
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel before an early morning flight. We specifically asked for quiet room when we checked in and was placed in a wheelchair accessible room, giving up our suite for this "quiet room". It was no where near quiet, it directly faced the LAX runways. We expect some noise and with less than 5 hours a sleep, no time to change rooms or even properly get any sleep. Very disappointing service.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Tricali
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when I checked in here for 2 days for a conference at the hotel. The room is very spacious. Decor is modern, You have a small fridge and a microwave at the mini bar area. They also give you 2 bottles of water 16oz size, a bag of pretzel and twizzler free of charge. In room coffee is Rain Forest Alliance certified French Roast. I didn't drink any because they provide Starbucks coffee (Verona) everyday in the made to order breakfast downstair in the atrium area. It's open from 6-10AM everyday. You can also go to the manager reception from 5:30-7:30pm at night for free drinks. Overall, I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. If you drive in then ask for a business package deal for $166/nt including the $21/d parking rate and internet (~$10/day). If you rent a car then pick Budget as it is next door to this hotel and you can drop off the car literally next door and use the shuttle from Embassy every 15 minutes back to to the airport. There is a Burger King 1 block to the left of the hotel if you don't want to order their overpriced in room foods. They will charge you 15% to deliver to your room. The pool is small but it's in door so it's nice. The business center has 3 computers. If you need to print something but you don't want to go down there and wait then you have an option to print it online using the website they provide in room. They will email you a code in which you can take it down there for printing instead of waiting for the computer in that room. The WiFi here is strong. Your speed will be 144Mbps. Hope this helps. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches!!”
Reviews.Author: Familytravlr2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel thinking about the conveneience of the location being close to the airport and it bring part of the Hilton chain. The Hilton should be ashamed to have this location affiliated with them. I've stayed at many embassy suites before and have loved each one. This one however, not so much! We checked in and the front desk did not have very good customer service. They were having a personal conversation so our presence was not acknowledged. When we finally did checked in and went to our room to unpack, we discovered roaches in the bathroom. And I don't mean just one or two but roaches in the sink, the drain, the vent on the ceiling and the walls. It was awful!! We called the front desk and they did not seem surprised by this at all. So they moved us to a room 4 doors down, right next to the elevator. So naturally we didn't get much sleep. Desperate for coffee the next morning we went down for the complimentary breakfast. That's when we found bugs crawling in the cups. We left the food and went to our room to clean up and pack up. That's when we seen the roaches in that room. We ran out of there and went to the front desk, where again, good customer service must not be required. The manager said they usually charge a $35 early check out fee. After much discussion that fee was waived and we were given 50% off our nights stay. I would NOT reccomend this location to anyone, not even an enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to LAX and big suite”
Reviews.Author: Marcus H
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good place to stay if you have just gotten off a long flight. I had just come from London and was totally beat! The room provided me with the perfect place to relax and crash after the long trip. You can hear some noise from the airport, but in my case it didn't bother me a bit. The Manager I dealt with when checking in was really helpful and made the check in process easy. Would recommend especially because of comfort level and proximity to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Only if You Arrive in LA after a 14 Hour Flight”
Reviews.Author: SiskiyouTraveler
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites is located very close to LAX. Yes, that means you are going to hear jet noise all night long. This can be overcome to some degree with ear plugs but it is hard to get a restful sleep here. The other significant problem is that the garage space is very undersized and cannot accommodate as many cars as the guests have. On two nights, the manager directed us to park in "No Parking" zones and on a third night we had to park on the street. Embassy Suites actually charges for this parking space "lottery." I would only recommend this hotel if you arrive in LA after a long flight want a place to crash that has an airport shuttle. To be fair, this property has been updated to escape the 1980's look many Embassy Suites seem stuck in. The rooms have contemporary decor and are large and quite pleasant. The room layout is a good choice for families with kids. As with all ES, the breakfast is a good value with a variety of choices and plenty of food.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for price and location”
Reviews.Author: StylishLittleFamily
Reviews.Content: My first LAX stay. We had 7 hour lay over before our flight with 2 & 4 year olds. Outside isn't much, but inside the room was newly renovated, clean, fluffy beds, nice white linen, kids bath only, heated pool and small hot tub, free shuttle, restaurant downstairs, cocktail hour in lobby at 530pm (kids loved popcorn), business centre, very slow wifi. Perfect for one night or we had a day rate. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value and great location”
Reviews.Author: wallysaskatoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after a cruise. The hotel is situated 2 short blocks from Avis car rental drop off, and is a 5 minute shuttle to the LAX Terminal. When we arrived, we enjoyed a managers reception with complimentary cocktails and snacks, the rooms are 2 room suites, each room containing 40 flat screen TV's. In the morning there is a complimentary breakfast, omlettes made to order, the staff was friendly and very efficient and the shuttle runs to the airport every few minutes. Our airline made a sudden change to our itinerary at another terminal location and the shuttle driver waited for almost 10 minutes while we got things sorted out. Room service was very good and inexpensive. I would highly recommend this property. Our stay for all the above was less that $125.00 CDN. (plus well deserved tips..of course)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but...”
Reviews.Author: jensan89
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed here for Anime LA for 4 night. It was a very nice place to stay. The bed was very comfy and the room was bigger than I thought. Their free hot breakfast was excellent and was very happy about their happy hour. The only reason it was four stars because, without warning, they charged me about $200 extra just in case something happens I suppose and currently waiting for my refund. I wish I had some kind of warning >.< But overall for the rate I paid, it was a lot of better than expected

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accomodations and service!”
Reviews.Author: bgtours2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were catching a cruise out of LA and needed 1 night's accommodations in LA. We were very impressed with the service and accommodations. For the price we paid, we had much lower expectations. From our initial check-in (where we were able to check in nice and early), to their suggesting the shuttle, to the afternoon free happy hours with appy's, to them arranging transportation for the next day and then a wonderful quiet room for the evening and a great breakfast the following morning...it was awesome. Probably the best hotel we've ever stayed at in this price range. thanks for everything and I'm sure we'll stay here again if we pass through LAX. B&G Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “A good value at the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Louvul
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. We arrived late, the shuttle service got us there quickly and we were able to go to our room to sleep quickly. The breakfast was wonderful and added to the value. We also took time for a swim in the indoor pool to exercise the kids before going into Southern California traffic. It was nice clean, quiet and easy. Just what we wanted in an airport hotel. I was able to take the shuttles to pick up the rent a car easily.

Reviews.Title: “One of the cleaner Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: MikiSMLA
Reviews.Content: Considering that it was close to the airport, I never really felt like I was in the middle of the airport runway with planes taking off and landing. The rooms were clean and the breakfast food cooked well (bacon was crisp and not soggy, omelets well made). Car rentals are nearby, and Hertz even dropped me off at the hotel as it was on the way to the terminals. My only bad experience was with the airport shuttle on my most recent stay, from hotel to airport. I reported the rude driver (#13, in case shuttle company is reading this) to the front desk, and he was kind enough to be understanding and promised to report him to the shuttle bus company. Otherwise, I will not hesitate to stay there again next time I am in town and in transit.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport hotel does make a difference”
Reviews.Author: Tankster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, the usual for the "airport hotel" experience. And while these are often quite lackluster, this place was a hoot- we loved their cocktail hour (and tried to decide if you really can call popcorn a meal)and had a decent glass of wine to help that decision along. It helps too that this place is QUIET. SO quiet we could not hear our grandson in the next room. Shuttle worked fine, really clean place and overall quite the decent LAX location. We have certainly stayed in far worse airport locations.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, wi-fi needs work”
Reviews.Author: indytraveler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights 12/29-31st, great breakfast and social hour. Staff friendly and shuttle bus to airport prompt. Only complaint is the wi-fi didnt work in our room, they sent a tech up to reset the wireless router. It didnt help, but the front desk quickly removed the charge from my bill. Workout room adequate , would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow; This has to be the best LAX Hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtrav2011
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in pretty much all the main LAX hotels over the years, but the Embassy Suites LAX North was by far the best. It offers a fantastic two room suite - a proper suite - not a single room divided being called a "suite" as is so common these days. The room decor was exceptional with luxurious high quality fittings and latest specification flat screen TV's. The bed was outstanding with superior comfort and the room was way above average in cleanliness, even when I checked around the bed and around the edges - areas that rarely get cleaned in most hotels!! We also used the nice indoor heated pool to try to keep us awake and adjust us to LA time after our long flight from London. It's a very nice, decent sized clean pool with hot tub. By far the best aspect of this hotel is its superb staff. Nothing was too much trouble and the guy they had serving the fantastic FREE breakfast was great - cooked to order high quality food with a really positive attitude that we've rarely experienced in the US. Front desk staff were chatty and nice too. Official start time for breakfast was 6am weekdays - but we had to leave soon after that - and found that the breakfast was actually ready at 5:45am which helped! Now the bad points - AIRPORT NOISE and PARKING CHARGES. Even though we were on the side of the hotel the single glazed patio doors let in quite a bit of plane noise - so take earplugs like (I always do!) and you'll be fine. Not sure why LAX allows planes to take off and land at silly times of the night - but you can expect some level of sleep disturbance. If this is a problem - try the Springhill Suites at Hawthorne as that is about 3 miles south of the Airport - and although nowhere near the level of comfort of the Embassy Suites and a much smaller room size - the airport noise is pretty much non existent and the parking is free - rather than the ridiculous $21 the Embassy Suites charged! So, overall the Embassy Suites was a five star experience and a highly recommended LAX hotel - the best LAX hotel for the price in my opinion. So much so in fact that the next 3.5 star hotel we stayed at looked a bit tired in comparison. The management should take the breakfast guy who was serving on 20 Dec and give him employee of the month for starters!

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Niksia
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious. The atrium is brilliant. Free breakfast is ample. The staff though are amazing. Very knowledgeable and keen to help. We did request a high room and got one on the top floor and on the airport side. We had a clear view of planes taking off and landing. We could hear some road and plane noise from here, but nothing that disturbed our stay. The only real negative was no free internet. You have to use one of 2 computers in the business lounge. Handy if you want to stay near LAX as the free shuttle comes regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy! Lousy Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: chiot
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here on our way back from Cleveland following my husband's heart surgery as we had a long layover and thought the suites would be more comfortable than just a room. Based on previous TripAdvisor reviews, we requested a room on the side of the hotel away from the airport. The first room they gave us had a loud ventilation vibration coming from the walls. We were situated at the back of the hotel where the heating and cooling systems are and the noise traveled up. They moved us to the 7th floor and the noise was better, but still loud enough to be disturbing. They told us there were no other choices, so we decided to make the best of it. Bed is located by the sliding glass window and so light comes through the crack on to the bed in the morning. The motor in the heating system was making a noise and the engineer came up to fix it and said the entire motor needed replacing, and there was nothing that could be done that night. We slept without the system on, although the loud vibration from the exhaust systems was still a disturbance. At about 4 am the planes began taking off at regular intervals and they were loud enough to prevent us from getting back to sleep at 5 am. After tossing and turning until 7 am, I finally got up. The cocktail hour is really a rag tag sort of affair with cheap rot gut wine, popcorn and various bar nuts etc. If you are fan of warm cheese food on corn chips you can make a meal of it here. The free breakfast is only offered until 9 am and then the kitchen closes and you cannot get a real meal until 11, but forget breakfast of any sort. Not offered after 9. Although the rooms have been refurbished we found the black and brown decor heavy and unappealing as well as the heavily patterned carpets )also in black and brown). Atrium is full of uncomfortable furniture that reminds one of a high school cafeteria with tropical foliage. In short, it's a "deal" if you don't mind the decor, are in to cheap freebees and don't mind hearing ventilations sytems or airplanes when you sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to airport with free shuttle and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: cocolobaglades
Reviews.Content: Good as airport hotels go, very clean and spacious. Breakfast buffet is free and offers a good selection of items. No soy milk.

Reviews.Title: “Great layover spot”
Reviews.Author: KMFR_10
Reviews.Content: On our way to a long vacation, this was an excellent option for my wife and our friend. The services as good, the breakfast buffet was filling, and the evening drinks/snacks were welcomed! The staff was professional and pleasant. I certainly recommend this location if you have a quick layover or if you have an international flight from LAX. The free hotel shuttle, and proximity to the airport make it right for a one night stay. The cost were reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ruhk
Reviews.Content: Like many other Embassy Suites we had a great breakfast, friendly hotel staff, very nice common areas. The room we had was facing the airport. It sounded like the jets taking off right under our window! It was the noisiest room I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: sneachtaban
Reviews.Content: We had a good but not great experience at the Embassy Suites. The rooms are big and comfortable. There's the big buffet breakfast that Embassy usually has. The hotel has a nice pool and the staff are very friendly. The hotel is very close to LAX. Parking is $21 a night, but this is reasonable for a a hotel so close to the airport. Internet is $10 per night. My only real issue is that the hotel was noisy during the night we stayed (i.e. middle of night). This was mostly due to a party - you can also hear planes at LAX, but the plane noise is not so noticeable and limited during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: tbrown_48
Reviews.Content: After a 14 hour flight I was completely exhausted and was not optimistic about getting in to my room early at the Embassy Suites. I was extremely pleased with the reception I received from the front desk who checked me in straight away, invited me to have some complementary breakfast and made me feel genuinely welcome. My standard suite was quiet, clean, roomy and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was very generous. Too tired for anything else, I spent the afternoon sleeping and ordered room service for dinner. The food was good and the service fast. I really enjoyed my stay at the Embassy and will definitely stay again when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: csteen
Reviews.Content: All rooms are suites, which is nice. Beds comfortable. Free breakfast very good.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, elegant, value-for-money airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: nnonmac
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites was beyond my expectations given that it's so close to the airport and is so reasonably priced compared to airport/city hotels in Australia. It has a huge atrium with water features and feels spacious. Good food in the restaurant/cafe/bar. Good service. Perfect for a one-night stopover between Sydney and elsewhere in the US without breaking the bank. The rooms are very generous - my room had a King bed and lounge/sitting room. The bed had a luxurious pillowtop mattress. I'm a light sleeper, have a hip injury and have trouble sleeping. My room was very quiet and I slept well. My room faced Airport Boulevard. I didn't hear any noise from other rooms but I'm not sure if the rooms either side were occupied. Breakfast is included. Free airport shuttle. Very close to airport without being right under a flight path. I'll definitely be staying there again on the homeward journey!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: MaraInTO
Reviews.Content: My family had a very good experience at the Embassy Suites LAX North. It had everything we were looking for: an indoor pool, complimentary breakfast, large suites, a shuttle to LAX and was near the car rental companies. I also requested and received WIFI as part of my rate b/c many other hotels at LAX inc. free WIFI. The hotel has 8 floors and all the rooms are situated around the huge Atrium (see pic). On the main floor of the atrium is where they host Happy Hour and breakfast so every sound carries up to the rooms. However, you would only hear that if you were sleeping on the sofa bed (luckily, my daughter is a heavy sleeper). The king beds have a door to the room so we slept very comfortably. The suites are all renovated, spacious and gorgeous.The bathroom was heavenly. The one annoyance I have with all the hotels (not just this one) is that when I book a room for 3 ppl and that is clearly stated on the reservation, the room only has 2 towels or 2 pillows. This was the case at Embassy also where there were no blankets or pillows for the sofa bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: FitTravellerLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Stated here for a quick overnight trip to LA. Found the property to be very clean & what you'd expect for an Embassy Suites property. Our room was recently refurbished with contemporary decor which was very attractive. My only gripe was that the walls, both interior & exterior, seemed to be made of paper, hence the overall rating of "3.". We were on the fifth floor & could hear every bit of traffic...thank goodness we were in the back of the building! I can't imagine being in a room that was facing onto Century Blvd/the airport! At 4 a.m. I was awakened by my next door neighbor's wake up call. All in all, I would probably stay here again, however, the Embassy Suites in nearby El Segundo (also near the airport) is quieter.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Quispamsis058
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to end our ten day trip to Los Angeles and area because it was so near the airport. Good decision! We were greeted by friendly staff that made checking in a breeze. Front desk personnel and porters friendly and professional. Even before settling into our room, we were told that there would be a wine and cheese reception in the early evening, and we decided to take advantage of this little perk. Our room was a real surprise. It was so spacious and offered a seperate living space apart from the equally large bedroom. We were on the eighth floor near the elevator, but honestly we never heard other guests coming or going. Breakfast was included in the price of the room, and included freshly prepared omelettes, coffee, toast/muffins, juice, fresh fruit, pasteries, yogurt, fried potatoes and bacon. We had turned the rented vehicle in the day before and really appreciated the quick and efficient shuttle that was available on a regular/20 minute interval. We found this hotel on Expedia.ca, and price was great for all the amenities included. HIghly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A suite for the price of a room”
Reviews.Author: Racam
Reviews.Content: Shuttle from the airport common with HILTON airport (another Embassy suites near the airport has another shuttle).Remember this is the NORTH one. Huge suite with all comfort (bath high enough,compared with most others).Big fridge,coffee machine,safe etc... Cocktail from 5 to 7 p.m. given by the manager. Excellent breakfast with eggs cooked to order. Free internet in business office ONLY (fee in your room). Parking at $21/day+,but 100 yards away 2 parkings at half this price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ange1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two LAX hotels due to flight schedules and Embassy Suites was by far the best. Gorgeous two room suites make for a very comfortable stay. Airport shuttle runs regularly. Breakfast was a huge hit with cooked to order omelettes and all the usual breakfast buffet options (in fact this was the best complimentary breakfast we had on a 3 week US trip). Their onsite restaurant was also very nice. Carls Jr is also a short walk away which our son just loved! If I was wanting to explore LA I would stay somewhere closer to all the action but for a fabulously convenient airport hotel I wouldn't stay anywhere else but Embassy Suites and will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; great price”
Reviews.Author: Syk9dl
Reviews.Content: Arrived quite early. They gave us breakfast vouchers when I stated that I was hungry. They then stored our luggage and arranged for LA tour that was quite enjoyable. Our room was great and spacious. Drinks and snacks that evening were fine. Breakfast the next morning was again fantastic. Staff was courteous and went beyond expectations. We left for our cruise in a great mood. All of this for an internet rate of $108 plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations with easy access”
Reviews.Author: gingerluc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights on business while training in LA. Easy access to airport and car rentals. Accommodations were great; comfortable and extremely quiet given how close the hotel is to the airport, with a nice manager reception each night and great breakfast each morning. Staff very accommodating and helpful. Room was very spacious, bathroom also spacious. Plenty of room to spread out or share with a family. Absolutely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, noisy traffic”
Reviews.Author: MNetrip
Reviews.Content: The LAX Embassy Suites was a very accommodating hotel with nice amenities. The happy hour and breakfast are well appreciated. The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. This hotel does offer allergy-free rooms for slightly more. The only negative thing I can say about the stay was that you can hear a good deal of traffic that buzzes by on airport road. Bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper to drown out the traffic. The windows were not thick so I suspect that's where the noise came in (at least in Room 504). I was worried about hearing planes, but didn't hear any.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay by the airport”
Reviews.Author: fluffybinks
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night. This hotel is well-located if you want to be near the airport. The hotel is one row back from the runway meaning it is not as noisy as some hotels that face the runways directly. In fact, you could barely hear anything. We arrived really early about 9.00 am and they allowed us to have breakfast while we waited for the room to be prepared. We got into the room around 10.15 so this is great since check in is supposed to be 3.00 pm. Twin room is very spacious and it has a comfortable reasonable sized lounge room with all the mod cons and a v. small servicable kitchen (no cooktop) but microwave, crockery, fridge etc. all there. Nice appointed bathroom. Manager's reception between 5.00 - 7.00 pm a hit with cocktails/wine/beer and some nachos etc. The breakfast was reasonably good considering its complementary, there was plenty of variety and there is a place to order omelettes, fried/poached eggs etc. The staff were very friendly and helful. I will stay here again when needing a short stop in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Do It Again”
Reviews.Author: boondogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Jan or Feb of 2011. Bed was very cozy. Room was spacious and able to close door to the other part of suite. Bathroom was updated, though the room's wardrobe closet or armoire was a bit ratty, although spacious and able to spread our items around. No bed bugs - I checked thoroughly. Although we overlooked the busy intersection and were directly above the tiny drive-through portico at entry, it was quiet for the most part - a few police sirens in the neighborhood. Don't remember hearing any planes.Shuttled back and forth to the airport with no trouble; it's so close. The airport - now there's another story. I'm spoiled with Denver's airport. Yes, I digress. Folks at front desk were exceptionally pleasant and omelet maker man was phenomenal. Great breakfast was included. There's a nice restaurant (aside from breakfast area) within the E.S. where we ate supper twice. Very yummy, though wine was pricey, but not expensive. Handy since we didn't want to go looking for a restaurant at night - we're hicks from the sticks and were tired. Definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME hotel experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Curtis W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 4 nights at this hotel and let me tell you....it was quite an experience...we didnt spend much time in the hotel because we were out touring LA....but the time we did spend there was VERY nice. The overall hotel is VERY nice, clean, great service and very friendly staff. The free breakfast in the morning was amazing...they have everything from made to order omlettes, scrambled eggs, waffles, pancakes, cerel, fruit, pastry's etc....the list goes on and its all included in your stay. They also have a "Happy Hour" that includes free drinks and snacks from 5 to 7 pm...which was nice as well. The rooms were very nice and clean....we had a massive room for just my wife and I, which included a suite with a king size bed. Was very nice. We did not get the chance to utilize the pool and hot tub area, but it looked very inviting. The locatiojn of this hotel was central to alot of different activities....if you need a car rental, there was a Budget across the street. We took a trolley from the hotel down to Manhatten Beach for $5.00 return, which was an amazing area and a great deal. It was only about a 25 minute drive to Universal Studios and the Hollywood areas. About 20 minute drive to Santa Monica Beach. 20 minutes to Citadel outlet mall. ....so all in all a great location with easy access to alot of different activities. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great deal and AWESOME hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatUNH1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here fro one night before flying out of LAX. You can't get much closer to the airport or the rental car returns, but you can barely hear the jets. The rooms are huge, comfortable, and modern. The staff was helpful and very efficient. The free breakfast and cocktail hour are the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Kakaboo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family for one night. This hotel surprised me, I haven`t expected to see something like this at very bussy airport. The room was very clean and big. The stuff very friendly. Breakfast was excellent. The lobby of the hotel is very nice. I definitely will be staying here next time I am back in LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, great value”
Reviews.Author: PJW1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was great value. The room rate includes a full breakfast, and the evening happy hour with drinks and snacks. The rooms were great, roomy and clean, and we loved the indoor pool and spa to relax before a long 13 hour flight home. The foyer of the hotel is very beautiful, and the layout of the hotel and the location of the restaurant is nice. We'd stay there again, and hope to on our next US holiday in 2012. It's close to the airport, but the hotel IS quiet, although we did wake during the night to a small earthquake - but that was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “First time visitor to LA”
Reviews.Author: sharon v
Reviews.Content: Loved the extra room a suite provides, saved money on the daily buffet breakfast, the every 15-minute free shuttle to and from the airport, the nightly manager's reception, the outstanding hotel staff, walk across the street to the car rental, all this and free internet. In these hard monetary times, if you want to be treated royaly, this is the place to stay. If money is no object for you, there are other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The building is a marvel...”
Reviews.Author: Mac_Maximum
Reviews.Content: What I found fascinating is that the building is something you don't see too often, a marvel. I am assuming the building was built a few decades ago, but its large open air atrium is something of a rarity in most cities. Certainly, proximiity to the LAX airport is reason for building such a monster (in a goodway) building. The restaurant had a very nice selection, although they ran out of their nightly special (NY Strip). It was fine, as I didn't have dinner until 10 pm. I wish I took some photos of the building, but you will have to view the other users. They have koi ponds, ducks in a portion of the building. Very nice place, and the rooms are very large. I mean, my room was basic, and it came with a wet bar.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: praguelover_9
Reviews.Content: We had an overbooking at the Custom Hotel and we had to move to Embassy Suites, so we were a bit stressed. But we had a very good reception and a great room with lots of space. The bath room was rather small, but we loved the breakfast, one of the best during our trip. Very handy shuttle service and kind people at the reception. They helped us when we had to confirm our helicopter flight over the Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovin2travel81
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for our overnight stopover in LAX. The beds were comfortable and the service provieded was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Love Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: BluegrassAnne
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Embassy Suites in several cities and they never disappoint. We chose this hotel because we were flying out the next morning and we got a great prepaid rate of $102 plus tax. We didn't arrive until 11pm. The front desk was friendly and did inform us about breakfast. The rooms were spacious, fully equipped, and gorgeous. Our first room didn't have sheets on the bed so we headed back to the front desk where they apoloigized and gave us another room. The continental breakfast was nice, but the line was pretty long for the "cooked to order" breaksfast. The continental breakfast included srambled eggs, pancakes, and a variety of other foods, but no meat. You had stand in the "cooked to order" line for bacon or sausage although it was pre-cooked, Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property!”
Reviews.Author: Annibananny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just off of the runways at LAX. Their breakfast, I found, was above average for an Embassy Suites and the service was incredible. I had an issue with my room which was resolved after one night; they needed to relocate me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: Spouse booked this hotel only for one night as we only really needed it for night. Hotel was really nice. Room was clean and spacious. PROS: free breakfast every morning. CONS: Front desk failed to mention during check-in; managers special for drinks during a certain time and that there is free continental breakfast every morning. Food in the restaurant was blah-could be better. NO free wifi or car parking, for the price of the hotel you think there would be a free wifi (cost is $10/24 hour period), and parking is $21/night. Otherwise, not a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AS ADVERTISED!”
Reviews.Author: Roccobaby
Reviews.Content: How many times have you seen an advertisement and then receiving the product it isn't what you thought. Not here!!! Just as shown. Just as promised. Just as I expect from an Embassy Suites. Rooms were large and very clean. Complimentary breakfast was outstanding. Lots of choices from fresh fruit, yogurt, and cereal to the chef made build your own omellette. I will stay here again when in LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK - Great location for late or early flight”
Reviews.Author: CasaMurguia
Reviews.Content: I arrived late with a planned stay for just one night; the shuttle from the Airport was fast when I finally got my bags. Check-In was extremely prompt and Brandon was great, checked if I needed help, if I needed anything like early morning wakeup call â€“ after travelling for 22 hours I have to say he was excellent. I was staying in suite 210 on the 2nd floor and this was a standard 2 room suite and given that I booked a â€˜Basic Non-Suite â€“ Kingâ€™ it was more than I expected. I had stayed previously at this hotel (a few years ago) and given that it was renovated I felt the furniture was new but worn already, the new TVâ€™s are better but the paint job is already worn looking, also bring back the full size pillows!! The suite was clean and I slept fine. I also booked a smoking room, when I called reception to advise that I did not get one they told me to smoke on the balcony â€“ unlike previous reviews it was plenty big and this worked fine for me. I was up early and to be honest they could do better with the breakfast, if it is due to start at 6am then be ready, it was 6.25 before they began to cook the orders for all the early starters. The food was the same as any Embassy Suites, fresh and tasty. Check-Out was simple, but the girl that assisted me could do with some manners, I felt she let the whole hotel down with her abruptness â€“ it does not take much to have some manners. Overall, the hotel was very convenient, Brando was excellent, the check out person needs to go back to manners school. Great location for a late night or early morning flight and donâ€™t bother parking â€“ either get the car the next day or return it after check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay awaiting a flight or long layover”
Reviews.Author: USMC_Retired
Reviews.Content: Overall Impression: Great place to stay awaiting a flight or long layover Room was spacious and spotless. With my Hilton Honors Diamond status, I received HH bonus points. PROs: -Airport shuttle runs every 15 minutes. 10 minutes from LAX -Convenient location to LAX -Newly renovated rooms - Breakfast and Evening Reception -No noise from the airplanes CONs: - $23 Self parking

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stop and Rest Between Flights”
Reviews.Author: BreathFreshAir
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at another hotel close to LAX when arriving and leaving the US, but as I am very fond of Embassy Suites, and as it was a little cheaper (including breakfast), we changed to the Embassy Suites Los Angeles International Airport North for this trip. We weren't disappointed. Great service from all staff, comfortable room, delicious breakfast, good shuttle service and the option to have a later check out (for a reasonable price) all made this the perfect option for an overnight stay. We were very impressed. The surrounding area is nothing flash, but this isn't really the location you would stay at for people wanting to have a vacation in Los Angeles. You could do that, but the main attraction for staying is the proximity and convenience to LAX. We were very impressed with the level of service, and the warmth and friendliness of the staff. We stayed on both the 10th and 28th August, and will definitely be staying again on future trips to the US--without hesitation. One little added bonus is that there is a Burger King just a few minutes walk down the road. Nice and simple for an overnight stay between flights. There is also a little kiosk near the front desk of the hotel, where snacks and other items can be purchased. But, of course, there is also the complementary Manager's reception every evening and delicious breakfast every morning. So many good reasons to stay at this particular hotel before heading off for the rest of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: master815k
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night one a layover at the hotel. Front desk was very nice and my son and I enjoyed the managers reception. When I checked in, you are made to sign a paper stating that you will not hold any parties in your room. Not a problem, I'm with my 5 year old son! When we returned from the manangers reception, the noise next door started. Loud music, people screaming and lauging. WHen I walked by the room to get ice, their door was propped open, they had streamers hanging from the walls and at least 10 people in there. Sounds like a party to me. Around 9pm I called to complain about the noise. Followed up with a second phone call around 11. Was told there was a wedding going on and that was probably the noise. She asked if I wanted to change rooms. Seriously? I have to move and there is a party going on next door? My mother arrived from her flight and slept in the bedroom area while I slept in the quieter area of the living room with my son. My mother had to put up with the noise until the wee hours of the morning. I guess you need to call more than two times to get something done. If you are looking for quiet, do not stay there on a weekend night when they have an event. I didn't have a chance to eat the breakfast in the morning, but it did look nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the business person”
Reviews.Author: brad b
Reviews.Content: Top location. Nice rooms. Room service was a bit of a mix up but they got it right in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: gojadego
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night (before our flight home). Our room was clean and not worn out at all; almost modern I'd say. I say almost modern because apart from our room the hotel itself is a bit dated as is the exterior (but all the hotels in the area are). For a hotel stay it's great and adaquate for a family that needs extra space. And with the made to order breakfast and managers reception it's what you expect from an Embassy Suites. Judging it for it's location it's a great suite option and a good value. I will stay here again if I need to be right by the airport. The shuttle was great and got all 6 of us to the airport in lightning speed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Road_adventures
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to Australia and decded to stop in Los Angeles to break up the trip. We chose the Embassy Suites LAX (north) and were not dissapointed. We were me at the door by the bell staff who handled our luggage. Check-in was a breeze. The rooms were very nice and the included breakfast was excellent. We wanted to take a tour of Los Angeles and inquired at the front desk. The front desk personnel were very helpful and setup the tour for us. They recommended a certain all day tour which turned out to be excellent. We were picked up and dropped off at the hotel. This was a pleasant experience. This hotel is five minutes from the airport. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Check you bill when you check out”
Reviews.Author: jaffass
Reviews.Content: Stopped in the embassy suites before flying back to the uk,rooms great hotel nice,you get charged Â£20 dollars to park your car,When i checked out of the hotel ,The hotel had charged me Â£9.95 twice for inter net when asked they told me it was because i had 2 lap tops ,when i told them i only had one,they said ok and only charged my once,also i booked the room online beware of hidden charges,and taxes,the hotel all so charge you a tourism tax,i have not got a clue what thats for as i stayed in other hotel in lax and didnt get charged that,also i had to use the other hotels in the area for to buy bits a bobs out of hotel shop ,the embassy suites only as a cupboard for a shop,BEWARE OF HIDDEN COSTS

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you're passing through town.”
Reviews.Author: Verucak
Reviews.Content: We stopped here overnight (July 31) before we started our drive up the PCH....great location for us as it was close to the airport and very convenient to several car rental companies. Everyone was very nice and pleasant. Only downside was that our room could have been a little cleaner....it wasn't terrible but it was definitely missing some finer touches (e.g. previous guests trash hadn't been emptied in the main area of the room).

Reviews.Title: “Good - but won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: adrianhobson
Reviews.Content: This is a two part review. We stayed here prior to a return flight to the UK in May 2011 - the night they caught Osama Bin Laden! The hotel is well located hotel at LAX which makes for a very comfortable overnight. The shiuttle from LAX may not be the most frequent but its a short ride to Airport Blvd. The interior of the hotel is a huge atrium with rooms facing in. It was something of an oasis from the bustle and general madness that is LAX. Rooms were, as you'd expect from Embassy, well appointed and comfortable. Ours had a mini balcony although the only thing to see outside was traffic. Soundproofing could have been better. I think I'd rather have had a fixed soundproofed window than one that opened onto the balcony. Hotel facilities were also good. There was a small indoor pool and a business suite with two PCs and free internet access. next to reception there was a 24 hour shop witha selection of drinks, snacks and last minute items. Drinks were also available from vending machines on each floor. The atrium was the location for the breakfast buffet. It looked really attractive for a relaxing breakfast although it was crowded and teh organisation of teh cooked to order items made service slower and more complicated than it needed to be. Overall it was disappointing but could be aesily improved. We returned the rental car before arriving. The car parking charges were rather high. In fact, if they'd been a bit lower I'd probably have stayed here for 3 days (instead we spent two days at the Raddison Residence Inn at Manhattan). Staff were helpful and efficient. Check in and out was quick. Overall, it was a nice place to relax before a flight home. So why won't I stay again? When I arrived home I found I'd been charged $5 for a bottle of water we hadn't used. mainly I was annoyed that they thought I was stupid enough to pay for an overpriced bottle of warm water when there was a refridgerated vending machine at teh end of the corridor that charged half that! I used the Hotel's online web form to advise them that the charge was incorrect and could they reconsider it - but didn't get an answer. I suppose I could have disputed the charge with Visa but, to be honest, life's too short to waste over a $5 overcharge. Instead I'll stay somewhere else when we visit LAX next (normally we pass through twice a year). Embassy Suites may be $5 up at the moment but they'll lose far more in turnover.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and a long wait for the shuttle.....”
Reviews.Author: Traveltogether2
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, we waited a full 30 minutes for the shuttle, while we watched 2 to 3 shuttles from 3 to 4 different hotels go by. When the shuttle finally came, it took another 15 minutes to get to the Embassy suites as they went to another hotel first. The desk clerk was very friendly but told us we would not get the king suite we reservied as all that was left were two queens. When we went to the room, I had to have my hubby tighten the toilet seat to use it - it was so loose. Also, there was a long brown hair on the toilet seat and several more on the floor. The enamel was chipped in the tub (supposedly this hotel is newly renovated) and the sink didn't drain. I thought this was a luxury hotel where everything would be in good working condition and clean but that was not the case. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cookeme45
Reviews.Content: The staff at this property went above and beyond, they were very helpful answering questions I never felt like we were bothering them. I wish i had thought to right names down because a couple of the people were so very nice. My husband and I checked out at 2 and went to the airport and were bumped from our 4:45 flight to a 11:45 flight, we didnt want to stay in the airport for 6-7 hours so we caught the shuttle back to the hotel and they let us store our luggage and wait in the lobby which was way more comfortable (thank you sooo much)!! And although the location isnt in walking distance of major stores or restaurants, all the major attractions were a quick car drive away. The rooms were clean and they all have balconies. The only complaint I have is the smoking room had a very strong cigarette odor, my husband smokes and I have been in other hotel smoking rooms and have never smelled the smoke. I asked for the room to be sprayed and housekeeping was on top of it, that helped a little but there has to be something else that can be done. Other than that everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “For an Embassy Suites - Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: MabelK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in July 2011 for business. The previous night, I had spent the night at the Embassy Suites in Downey, CA, so i was able to do a direct comparision. The Embassy Suites at LAX was over $200/night compared to $180 at the Downey location, and the rooms at LAX were less updated, especially the bathroom. The window had this weird film over it so that you couldn't see outside. I kind of felt like a prisoner in my own room. It looked like a sliding door, so I tried to open it and it triggered some alarm. So, needless to say, there wasn't much of a view. The inside of the hotel was nice, lots of plants everywhere, and there was a convenient shuttle to the airport, only about a 5 minutes ride. The room served it's purpose by giving me a place to sleep, but I found the room to be overpriced, and if i was traveling on vacation rather thatn busienss, i probably wouldn't choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quite hotel, just leave the truck at home!”
Reviews.Author: mou2
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suite is very close to LAX, but once in the hotel I never was able to hear any planes flight over. One of the runways for LAX is about 2 blocks away and the planes are very low at this point. Yet I would was able to rest well at this Embassy. The only problem I had was the parking. There is not much room for large size vehicles like a pickup truck. I drove there with a Chevy Silverado truck and things were very tight. So tight I may have needed a car opener to get the truck out. First to turn into the parking lot you do not have much room with a truck, but once in the lot there are "few" spots on the ground level. Well no problem, just drive to the underground parking, if you are able to make the sharp turn into the down hill ramp. Once you can get in below the next problem will be finding a large spot, as most 90%, are compact size. If you have a small car NO problem, but us country folks with the truck are a bit out of luck. I was able to find a spot, but it took a lot of turning and backing up and moving and a bit of ______ yelling at myself.............but it got funny and I made it. Overall it was not too bad, it just became a laughable thing. I kept say, "I knew, I should have brought the car and not the truck". So if you drive there leave the truck or other large vehicle at home.

Reviews.Title: “Typical good quality Embassy Suites!”
Reviews.Author: FFPointsRGreat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and this is a typical Embassy Suites, which is to say it is very good. Nice room, lots of space and a good breakfast. If you know what to expect from Embassy Suites then you will be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “location is great, otherwise adequate”
Reviews.Author: sockrebel
Reviews.Content: The guy at the front desk when checking in was nice, just very absent-minded. I checked in around 2. As I was leaving to go up to my room, he said "thanks for visiting, come again." ?!? Aren't you supposed to say that when checking out, not checking in? Anyway, I went up to my room, and the key didn't work. So I had to come back down. He made some new keys, and I went up to the room, and it was a complete mess. So I came down yet again, and put me in a different room. How annoying! $21 to self-park my car - dang! The elevators at this place are crazy. They work sporadically. I got in one of them, pressed my floor number, the elevator doors closed but didn't move. A couple times, I got in the elevator to go down to the 1st floor, and it skipped the 1st floor altogether and went to the basement/parking garage. I'd then press 1 to go up to the 1st floor, and it would skip it again, taking me to the 2nd. I would've thought it was me that was crazy, except there was at least one other person in the elevator with me each of these three times. And you have to use the elevator. There is no way to get up from or down to the 1st floor via stairwell. The restaurant at the hotel is adequate. Not a lot of selection on the menu (I ate there lunch and dinner), but the food was pretty good. The wait staff were friendly and didn't rush me at all. The workout room has got a few treadmils, elliptical machines, and stationary bikes. There's a free weight set and benches, and a couple of exercise balls. Plenty sufficient for a hotel fitness center. I didn't go swimming though. The pool was overflowing with people, and the chlorine could be smelled all the way down the hall. But as I said, the location of this place is awesome! Not a bad place to crash the night before an early morning flight. The room was nice and clean and well laid-out. A TV in each room. And I like that you can see the TV from the desk, while I'm working. I appreciate the free internet access for HHonors Diamond members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cabotoy
Reviews.Content: Checked in after a flight from KC and before our 11 pm flight to Rarotonga. No problem storing 11 pieces of luggage. The hotel and staff was very accommodating. The happy hour was great. Adults watched the NBA Championship while the kids ate munchies. Spacious and comfortable. Shuttle service was timely and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Us”
Reviews.Author: janandgreg
Reviews.Content: I spent several hours on Trip Advisor trying to find a hotel near the Airport and chose this Embassy Suites for location, free shuttle, proximity to our rental car pick-up, price and the breakfast. We arrived late and by the time we cleared LAX it was 1 a.m. The shuttle was prompt and the driver insisted on helping with our suitcases. At the hotel, our first room had an electrical problem, there were no lights working in the room. The desk clerk could not have been more apologetic but I had read about the ongoing renovations and it was not an inconvenience to have to change rooms. The second room I thought was even nicer and had been fully renovated. The king bed was very comfortable, with lots of pillows, and we slept well. No noise problem but we were on the side of the hotel, away from the Airport. The breakfast the next morning was a nice surprise: a lot of variety and lots of fresh fruit. The only little thing was the surcharge for WiFi access. In this day and age it would go a long way to include it in the room price. It is like being charged for the use of cable t.v. Otherwise all was good and for airport accommodations this was a good choice for our one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: greenstarlette
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites in general tend to be a dependable hotel experience...You get the complementary happy hour, complementary cooked to order & continental breakfast, nice large rooms, great fitness center.... This Embassy Suites hotel was no exception. The pool was slightly smaller than other Embassy Suites however the hotel was lovely as it has recently been renovated. The room in particular benefited from the renovation as I have stayed here before and after the renovation and the rooms now are extremely nice/modern. The fitness center was nice and empty both times I used it. Also, it has a key required to enter it which is excellent considering many wandering/unsupervised children tried to come in to play and since they didn't have a key it was great that my workout wasn't interrupted. Now for the CONS.... ---If you get a room facing Airport Blvd. it will be impossible for you to sleep! Not only do you hear the airplanes flying overhead (typical for all LAX hotels) but the road is so noisy and they must not have upgraded the windows when they renovated the rooms as the windows did not block out any noise ---The walls were also paper thin. Luckily the hotel was not fully booked when I was there and I was able to switch rooms to the quieter side (not facing Airport Blvd and instead facing a parking structure) and I was lucky that when I switched rooms that there wasn't anyone next to me ---75% of the hotel staff were extremely rude. The bellboy was extremely nice as was one front desk person. The rest were disgraceful. As a Hilton Honor Gold member I expected to at least be treated decently if not slightly better for my loyalty to Hilton and this was not the case here ---The free hotel to airport shuttle unfortunately proved that you get what you pay for. The shuttle is supposed to come every 15 minutes and as I was flying out mid-day on a Saturday I thought being down at the lobby ready to go 3 hours before my domestic flight would not be a problem however due to the undependable airport shuttle, I almost missed my flight. I waited 55 minutes for the shuttle that was supposed to come every 15 minutes. There was a shuttle that came however the driver would not let me and another passenger (there were 2 of us waiting) get on and told us we had to wait for the next one. When we explained our situation he was not empathetic and instead suggested that we try to get a taxi which I found to be extremely rude considering this was supposed to be a free service. (NOTE: The shuttle is not just for the Embassy Suites but is a shared service with other hotels in the area) and this driver, although there was room, had a bee in his bonnet and would not let us on even though there was room for both us and our luggage. When the 2 of us complained to the hotel they said they would send a private shuttle for the 2 of us however that private shuttle never came (or maybe it did but finally the normal shuttle did arrive which we were able to get on albeit 55 minutes later) ---As Hilton Honors Gold, I had free Internet however if you aren't Hilton Honors Gold you have to pay for Internet ---Parking is extremely expensive ($21 + tax) even for visitors. I wanted a friend to visit me and even for her to park for 1 hour it was going to cost a lot ---There was a loud party going on in the hotel and despite their "anti-party policy" it took them quite a while to break it up. As a woman staying alone on this occasion, I did not feel safe with the drunk men from that party leering at me as I walked back to my hotel room after dinner... Overall, if you want to stay at an Embassy Suite, the one South of the Airport is much better. If you want to stay at a hotel near LAX then I'd choose another one not this one unless you get a great cheap deal, are guaranteed you don't get a room along Airport Blvd. and either their shuttle service improves or you just take a taxi to save you headache. I paid a very low price to stay at this hotel and it turns out I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is very good and should we visit LA again, we will definitely stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Thanapal
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in Embassy Suites Los Angeles International Airport North for four nights from 10th to 14th June 2011. The hotel is very close to the Airport and a complimentary shuttle service is provided to and fro by the hotel. This suite comprises of 2 queen beds and 1 sleeper sofa which can easily accommodate 5 people. The room is equipped with all the necessary amenities such as coffee maker, ironing board, microwave oven, fridge etc. Daily buffet breakfast is served. My family and I had a very pleasant stay. The complimentary shuttle bus from LAX was prompt and even the bus drivers were very courteous and helpful in loading our luggage on to the bus. The front desk staffs are all very helpful. However I have to compliment on one Mr. Michael who is the most outstanding guy among them. Another one is Mr. Ryan who is also very helpful. The breakfast is good but the menu is the same throughout my five days stay. The in house restaurant offers very delicious food. On the whole my family and I enjoyed our stay throughout. Should I visit LA again I will definitely choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated, Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: lovelytan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to and from Hawaii. The hotel is very newly renovated and very nice. We used the hotel shuttle and it came around every 15 minutes. The staff was very friendly. We arrived during the manager's reception and while we didn't attend, everyone seemed to be having a good time. We did eat in the restaurant and the food was very good. Highly recommend the chicken fettuccine. If I was coming to LA for a longer trip, I would stay here the rooms are spacious enough that I didn't feel like I was in a cramped hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Catbar57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to our long flight home to Australia. We had two free nights as a Hilton Honors Member and we were able to keep our room until late in the evening , just prior to going to the aiport, because of this. Lourdes greeted us on arrival and we were quite a few hours prior to advertised check in and our room was available immediately. Ryan assisted us with our luggage and gave us valuable advice regarding the bus to Santa Monica Beach and we were very grateful for that. It cost $3.00 return on the busfor two of us for a lazy afternoon. The staff here were very helpful and very friendly. We had an issue with an overflowing toilet and shower not working and a staff member was sent up within ten minutes and it was fixed immediately. We had a lovely meal at the restaurant which was only ruined by some very selfish guests who were very loud and very drunk, not the fault of the restaurant. This hotel has a great shuttle to the airport and is very convenient and would be an ideal location to stay for a few days just for a break. Free internet and printing in the business centre was also great as we do not have a laptop. Great to see the planes landing and even though we were so close to the aiport the noise wasn't too bad at all and we slept quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: socalmr
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites property is one of the best! The location from LAX can't be beat. Its only about a 5 minute ride on the hotel shuttle to the terminals. The property is clean, most rooms have been renovated, and the staff are nice. Also, this property offers a few extra items at breakfast which I don't notice at other ES hotels. Managers reception is good and the fitness center has good equipment.

Reviews.Title: “The parking and Wi-Fi are expendive”
Reviews.Author: Innovatory
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights last week. Generally speaking it is a nice hotel of good value, and the employees are trained very well and friendly. The overnight parking fee is high: $23 per night in the basement level, also there is no Free Wi-Fi as most of hotels are offering of this class. It is $9.99 per day for wireless Internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for LAX Location”
Reviews.Author: cindy5o4
Reviews.Content: Had a layover flight and stayed one night at Embassy Suites North. - Room: Very Spacious. Living room seperated from bedroom. Pull out couch was a plus. Coffee makers available. - Business Center: computer I used (closest to entrance) is so slow. I think it's time for an upgraded unit. It took a few tries before I could print my boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel but just one problem...”
Reviews.Author: wendy5o4
Reviews.Content: MERITS: Reviews of this hotel seemed mostly positive on TripAdvisor and was one of the reasons why I chose to stay at this hotel. Rooms are large and updated. Rate I paid was very reasonable by LAX Airport standards. Check-in was quick, friendly and efficient. Breakfast was complimentary and had 2-3 hot items to go along with the basic cold breakfast items. SMALL CONS: Room smelled somewhat strange...almost like a brand new room smell? Coffee maker didn't work but someone came to fix it within 20 minutes. The vent in the ceiling right before you enter the bedroom was coming off and could possibly fall on a person's head if not screwed in eventually. Hairdryer did not work but I didn't complain to the front desk since I didn't really need it. The lamp light by the bed worked, but the outlet right beneath the bed did not work when I went to plug my phone charger...also didn't complain about this since there were plenty of other outlets in the room. BIG CON: At breakfast time, the guy cooking the omelets put two $1 bills on the counter so guest would assume that a tip was necessary. I saw at least 3 other guests put $1 bills on the counter and it looked rather tacky with all these $1 bills spread all over the place. Normally, you should put a tip jar or a tip plate on the side of the counter, but this guy placed the two $1 bills right smack in the middle of the front counter.
