I don't have a problem tipping (I tipped the HK before I checked out), but his procedure was rather unnecessary and kind of put me off. Makes you wonder whether a guest is suppose to pay or what happens if you don't tip considering the breakfast is complimentary? Perhaps management might want to research this matter because at the other 3 to 3 1/2 star hotels I stay at, they don't allow employees to do this because again, it's rather tacky..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base near airport, good value and service”
Reviews.Author: RestfulLondon
Reviews.Content: Great base for 3 days near airport after long transatlantic flight. Free shuttle arrived fairly quickly and short trip to hotel. Initial reception a little frosty but after this all staff were helpful and cheerful even phoning local garage for us to see if they sold mobile topup cards. Area feels safe but being near the airport there isn't much local (apart from other hotels.) Big clean rooms, comfy beds. No problems with plane or traffic noise. Little kitchenette with fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Made use of pool and spa every day. Free business centre provides Internet access if you don't want to pay for wi-fi. Breakfast and managers reception both add to the value of this hotel. Parking available just behind hotel for about $12 per day if you need it. Good bus service up and down the coast from just outside the hotel allowed car free first few days. Only downside we didn't get the promised in-room safe although we were in a refurbished room (very nice too) which should have had one. Apparently their builders let them down! Great start to a 3 week tour of the SouthWest (stupendous scenery) will certainly use again if in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in LA”
Reviews.Author: mitchellaustralia
Reviews.Content: My family and I were looking for a hotel to stay at prior to our 15 hour flight back to Australia and the Embassy Suites had received some good reviews on trip advisor so I went ahead and prepaid via the net a few weeks in advance. The hotel rooms are very spacious and clean. A free breakfast (huge selection) was included and there were free drinks during happy hour (5.30pm to 7.30pm) where they served drinks and snacks. The location is very convenient for a number of reasons ie: I dropped my hire car at Avis and walked back to the room; We caught a bus (Big Blue) to Santa Monica for a day trip; The hotel has an airport shuttle that took us to our terminal when we were leaving. I booked for 2 nights but checked out at 8pm on night 2 because we were flying back home. This gave us the advantage of having a room to relax in, shower and leave our luggage prior to the flight. Outstanding staff and amenities make this hotel a definite choice when I come back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beginning to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Spalover33
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Embassy after our flight into LAX before embarking on a road trip which started in Las Vegas. We were pleasantly surprised to find the Hotel was such a high standard. The room was large, with a separate lounge area and kitchenette. We headed down to the bar as soon as we arrived and spent a very pleasant couple of hours recovering from our long flight. The staff were very friendly and professional. We had a goodnight's sleep in comfortable beds. We were not expecting too much of the complimentary breakfast but were more than satisfied by the choice available. We checked out after enjoying a thoroughly good value for money stay at a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A room right out of the old 70s reruns”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: If you think back to the raunchy motels you see in the movies, this room fit the bill. The room had very poor lighting, decor out the 70s, and carpet that buckled so much in the bedroom that I could have tripped, hurt myself, and probably won a settlementt. As a Hilton Honors member, this clearly was the worst example of a hotel room I've ever stayed in under the Hilton name. Check-in was fast and pleasant, and the clerk was kind and helpful. Upon getting up to the room, things went down hill from there. The entry into the room was interesting because the entry door had a mechanism for shutting the door very fast and quickly. I've never seen a door shut with such vigor and a slamming noise; good thing I didn't have any kids with me because they might have been injured. The sitting room looked worn and uninviting. I felt that I had walked into someone's old apartment. While the room didn't smell or have odors, just the appearance alone might make you think you were in a 1.5 to 2 star property. Coffee maker worked well. Now, onto the bedroom area. There was a huge dresser wall unit with a huge mirror with a table below for either a television or for working. I wished I had taken a picture of it because it, too, was something very tired looking and not the kind of appropriate furniture one finds in a hotel, but rather someone's large bedroom in suburbia. The bed was actually comfortable and the linens were clean and starchy feeling. The bathroom was adequate but had wallpaper that was probably around at the time of the Mod Squad television show production during the 70s. Water pressure was good and there was an adequate supply of towels. The bathroom was the only area of the room that was well-lit but it was stark and uninviting. Reminded more of nice motel along route 66. The balcony faced another building so there was no view. I can't criticize the hotel for this because it was night and there was nothing to look at anyway. I'm sure management tells the desk clerks to put late check-in guests in these rooms because they would have no need to look out the window/sliding door. I understood before I booked to stay here that they would be undergoing renovations. Having stayed here one night, I can see why. I will not be returning to this hotel at least until they renovate completely. It felt a little creepy being so outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight before cruise”
Reviews.Author: RioVistaMomma
Reviews.Content: Under renovation. But still very nice. We were in an "old" room, but it was clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the managers reception in the evening, had a nice dinner at the hotel restaurant and had a nice breakfast in the morning. Fast and easy transportation from LAX to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay - noisy renovations and aircraft noise...”
Reviews.Author: MarkGreenburg
Reviews.Content: Just came in from a 14 hour flight, very tired, and found that the rooms above us were being renovated. Loud hammering noise could be heard throughout the morning and afternoon. Their website does mention it but I feel that rooms shouldn't be booked out directly below construction noise, regardless. Furthermore, the side of the hotel we were situated on faced a runway probably 1/2 a mile away, which meant dealing with the loud noise of planes taking off and landing every 15-20 minutes late at night - vibrations could even be felt. I believe there is a quiet side of the hotel but they don't seem interested in letting you know about it. Curtains in the main bedroom don't satisfactorily block out the entire window, so much light enters from either side of the curtain, making morning sleep difficult. Room service menu is very limited (only 4 mains) compared to the offerings in the bistro itself. That said, food quality is good. Internet quite expensive, but reasonably fast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: Piharox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a 3 month Mexico, Cuba, California trip. As a family of 5 this was fantastic value. The 2 room suites are very spacious (even larger than the Embassy Suites El Segundo which weren't bad). The lounge dining area was big enough for a family of 5 to spread out in (we constantly found it difficult to book 5 in a room at most hotels so the 2 room suite represented excellent value). The room rate included the cooked breakfast plus in the evenings they have a Managers happy hour 5.30 to 7.30 which is complimentary wine, beer and spirits, drinks for the kids as well as snacks - pop corn, corn chips etc. When you're traveling as a family these extras are gold! The amenities are good - pool, spa and gym and the location for us was great as we were just relaxing waiting for our flight home. The staff were very friendly and the restaurant and room service was actually pretty good and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Deanna12
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of its proximity to my meeting and the reviews on tripadvisor. The room although spacious is dated, the breakfast and shuttle service were very good. Deanna Sgro

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine”
Reviews.Author: buffgirl73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after flying in late from the UK prior to driving down to Vegas. I'm not a huge fan of airport hotels full stop but after doing my research on Trip Advisor this appeared to be the best one in terms of reviews. The room was large and mainly clean (sofa felt a little grotty), and the bathroom was fine although it's a while since we had a bath and shower combo! Good power in the shower though to wash away the flight! The bed was comfortable and appeared clean although the pillows seemed to have a funky smell, not dirty, just sort of musty. We got a package whereby we parked for free and that saved over $20 and got a good rate as well. Room Service was fast, reasonable and the staff was pleasant. Basically this hotel does what it says on the tin. It's not the Four Seasons but it doesn't pretend to be and we had no cause for complaint, you get what you pay for basically.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here all the time....”
Reviews.Author: jtlinehan
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA almost every week and this is my first choice of hotels. Why? Three big reasons: First, the people who work at this hotel are really friendly, warm and professional. I think most Embassy Suites have strong staffs but here, they are more Ritz Carlton like than. I always get a nice greeting by name and a lot of warmth whether it's when I check in, when I go down for breakfast or to the reception; they always make me feel welcome and appreciated. That's nice. Second, the rooms are great. For families there's plenty of room and some degree of privacy with two large rooms. For us biz folks, we can use the front living room for meetings and the curtains can be opened to a full glass wall which makes for a more professional environment vs the bedroom at a Marriott. Or, if I am alone, the table is plenty big enough for paperwork, computers and a breakfast or dinner tray. And finally, the restaurant is surprisingly god. Great French Onion Soup, fish, and GREAT port chops more like you'd expect at a Morton's than an Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Crash Near LAX!”
Reviews.Author: delarana
Reviews.Content: I am generally not an enthusiast of the large, modern hotel, but I liked this one immensely! A shuttle to/from LAX and the best free hotel breakfast I've had -- including made-to-order omelettes! We got a great 1-bedroom suite (I guess they're all suites here?) for under $100/night because of our CAA/AAA membership. The same room a couple nights later was over $200! Definitely worth it if you can get a reasonable rate. My new favourite hotel for LAX stopovers!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - but charge for wifi???? No coffee???”
Reviews.Author: netbob
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the better hotels as far as attractiveness, but seriously lacking in two areas for us. I needed to make a SKYPE call to New Zealand (only one) on my DROID and in order to use their internet there is an additional and significant charge (I won't use Verizon skype). I walked about a half a block to the Super Eight motel and made the call from the street in front. In addition, I had a couple of emails to check on my DROID (I rarely use my computer any more). This is simply unacceptable in this day and age. After breakfast is over, the coffee urns are gone until the next morning. If you wish you can make coffee in your room. Their coffee makers are a wonderful idea, but do not work very well. Makes two cups, but if you want one, watch out. You can find coffee pouring out of the wrong hole. Now to the positive: The rooms are very nice and kept well cleaned. The swimming pool is clean and comfortable, the hot tub adequate for a few. The decor is tasteful. The breakfast food is very nice. They do have a peculiar way of changing serving hours for weekends and holidays as if we lived in LA and were not just passing through. Missed breakfast one morning, so check the hours and the date. If you need anything repaired they seem to have 24 hour maintenance. Front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Would have been perfect with wifi and coffee. All in all, a nice experience except for the wifi/internet and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfying experience.”
Reviews.Author: conando
Reviews.Content: Our experience was nothing short of perfect due to the great customer service, the wonderful breakfast, and overall warm environment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: adee74
Reviews.Content: I had to make an emergency trip to L.A. - my first time traveling to California. I have to say that the hotel staff treated me very well especially after factoring in my appearance. I was allowed to check in very early after making last minute reservations - at 6:30 a.m. - and I was not charged extra to do so. When asked, the desk clerk gave me free toothpaste and detergent to wash my clothes. The living room, bedroom and bath are all very large and spacious. The room included a working refrigerator and microwave which I appreciated. The hotel lobby is open and inviting with lots of seating. The only downsides are the in-suite internet charge and parking fee. My stay was only for one night and even though I didn't spend much time in the hotel, I would stay there again if I ever return to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Bad in every respect”
Reviews.Author: JustOneCarryon
Reviews.Content: There are so many negative points to list, I can't explain them all. This summary list will have to do: - airport shuttle not marked, one must guess which common shuttle applies - tried calling front desk phone to ask about shuttle, but no one answers their phone. - hotel kiosks at the airport give no record of the hotel existing. - bafflingly rude and slow front desk. Refuses to make eye contact and acts like the customer is a nuisance. - asked for a king bed, was told none available. On check-in, was told only king beds available, then found the room with two doubles. Is it really that difficult to keep track? - hair on the replenished goods in the bathroom. - airplane noise so loud in the bedroom, some furnishings rattle. - lobby music so loud in the front room, I could hear it from the shower (on the fourth floor: the atrium ensures it echoes into all rooms). - sole alarm clock in the room was broken. - black mold on the bathroom fan. - both lamps in front room were broken: one had a missing switch, the other burnt out. Run, don't walk, away from this atrocity. I'd have slept better on the floor of the florescent-lit terminal, amidst construction.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay over for LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: itravel100
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 3 children and grandparents. We booked two rooms and stayed for 2 nights. Although the hotel is dated it served our purpose, as a good hotel close to LAX, perfectly. The rooms are spacious and clean. The indoor pool was a hit with the kids and the nightly free drinks and snacks offered in the bar were very welcomed. We ate in the restaurant both evenings and enjoyed our meals and found the service very accommodating. We drove to Universal Studios and, with LA traffic, it took about an 1 hr each way. The free shuttle bus to the airport was very quick and allowed us to get to the airport hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “More bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: JSFULHAM
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel with lots of facilities included in the price .Big screen TV's, microwave, fridge, pool, fitness room, business centre with free boarding card printing, free breakfast and a manager's cocktail reception. Not eactly luxurious, but spacious well equipped suites and welcoming, friendly staff. There is a 24 hour store accross the street and a few fast food options close by. Admittedly there is airport noise but not excessive. Reliable frequent airport shuttle free of charge. I would stay here again. I wish we had value this good in rip off Britain! My only gripe was no in room safe and no deposit boxes were available at the Front Desk. For an airport hotel, I find this surprising and I would have felt more at ease had there had been a safe, even it cost to use it!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely positive ending to overseas vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Dmonto34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at this hotel after our vacation in Europe. The front desk were decent and the room was fine. We then proceeded to the 'Managers Reception' which was disappointing because free drinks meant poorly made drinks.,although the bartender was sweet. We asked a young waitress in the courtyard for a pepperoni pizza,an hour went by and no pizza,so we approached the waitress again (who had to pulled away from her cellphone)..only to be told we HAD NOT placed any such order with her. The Bartender placed the order and made a gin martini for my husband that was warm and had far too much vermouth,and if she had bothered to ask,my husband has a fondest for bombay sapphire gin....we decided to take the pizza to go.... we then lose our bartender to a 20 minute "crude" spanish conversation with 2 other employees and a cook...we are caucasians who understand spanish! ...this was unpleasant. I had ordered a chocolate martini ..it never came. The next day after a long day sight seeing and waiting for friends to arrive from LAX...We decided to call room service and no one answered...so we are forced to venture back into the restaurant. The phone is ringing of the hook...2 employees stand by the entrance telling us to sit anywhere....a new bartender is swamped with customers and asks for someone to answer the phone...she is frustrated and tells us she will be right back... the gentleman beside me, informs us he is a regular and this bartenders drinks are worth the wait..and although we waited a while ...we couldnt help but feel for this poor girl...who was run off her feet.. while others stood around...her 'wish i was an octopuss comment had us all laughing'... when we asked for a chocolate martini ...she offered me 4 different kinds..but insisted I try her ultimate chocolate martini..Which was so delicious I had 2!!.. My husbands gin martini was perfect..it was shaken so well it had shreds of ice forming on the top..and made with bombay sapphire. Our party arrives and we proceed to a table where a wonderful waiter called Jack took great care of us and helped us forget the evening before. The Rainbow trout was so good and our friends enjoyed the pasta dishes...the mahi mahi wasnt so enjoyable and the food took too long. Also the bickering amongst the staff and lack of teamwork really lets this restaurant down. Not ONCE did I ever see a manager and it seems that job is also left for the poor bartender to do. Around 10pm that evening my husband informs me he has lost his wallet, full of credit card and cash as we had just cashed a travellers note that day.. we search the restaurant...then the room...we called the restaurant and the woman on the other end tells us to call a manager tomorrow. By 11pm we are frantic...we call the restaurant one last time and the Bartender answers..she tells us she will look for it and call us back... 11.20 pm there is a knock on the door..it is the bartender holding our wallet. .we are amazed to find that not a dime is missing... we are so moved by her honesty that my husband tries to give her 100 dollars...she thanks us ..but refuses to except the money, I dont remember her name..shes a New Zealand girl and I wanted to share this experience with the hotel and other people like ourselves you value this kind of service . and the best chocolate martini you will ever taste.. Thank you ...we will be back.,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a layover in LA”
Reviews.Author: Antonius-Pax
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice for an overnight stay in LA while on transit from Florida to Australia. The rooms are inexpensive and well-appointed. THe staff are very attentive to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay going through LAX”
Reviews.Author: DelightsInTraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel overnight on our way out of the country to Baja. Coming from the East Coast we arrived late morning and went directly to the hotel and were very pleased to be able to check in early -- before 1:00. We enjoyed a nice lunch in the Bistro, relaxed in our spacious suite, and worked on our computers (we had our own internet connection so didn't have to pay for hotel internet usage -- the only downfall we could find with the hotel). We were very pleased with the complimentary evening manager's reception and the delicious and vast offerings for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing response from hotel re account discrepancy”
Reviews.Author: 10onwoodford
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel but when we arrived home several weeks later and reconciled our credit card payments with our accounts we found that this hotel had considerably overcharged us compared to the quote for accommodation that we had had in writing from them.. We have communicated with them several times and while they promised to deal with the problem and to send us through details we have never received such information. We are talking of more than two hundred dollars here, not a small amount. We now have our credit-card company dealing with the problem but he fact that the Embassy Suites would not deal with this personally is disappointing and unprofessional having me doubt their integrity.

Reviews.Title: “Brief stoppover in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: merrilees
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly staff. We had a 12 hour delay and bellman Carlos Caamal took care of all our baggage while the front desk organised a trip for us to Manhattan Beach. It turned what was going to be a long wait at LAX into a very pleasurable day. We will always remember the friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, friendly service and large comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: bartholomew513
Reviews.Content: very large fully equiped rooms with a large enclosed atrium. we felt very comfortable here, and although close to lax, we did not hear any aircraft noises. the breakfasts were excellent and the staff was helpful and friendly. we were part of a group travelling by a bus and therfore did not have to pay for parking which is expensive. the hotel restaurant for dinner was quite pricey. the hotel is in a remote area and there is not much to choose from for dining out. a car is a must in la and the traffic is horrendous! the freeways are constantly jammed up. our group was very satisfied with this hotel and we do recommend it to our fellow travelers. LA has much to see and do and we will be back for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond My Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: KingTazz
Reviews.Content: Whenever I think of staying in an airport hotel I cring as I expect to hear planes coming and going... I've stayed at several Embassy Suites and enjoyed the experience so I decided to give it a try. We arrived in early and were tired from our flight, I called for an early check-in and the were happy to accomodate us! The front desk was courtous and friendly. The room was spacious and clean. Coffee maker and refrigerator came in handy during our stay. Breakfast made to order but this was the first ES that kept the bacon and sausage behind the omelete counter. But they were very generous with their portions. Evening managers reception was a nice way to begin the evening. Great stay at this ES and no plane noise :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for short stop over in LA”
Reviews.Author: gojo39
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night stop over in LA and wanted to stay close to the airport to save on travel time. We had stayed in an Embassy Suites hotel in Walnut Creek, San Fran, 2 years ago and liked the hotel, so decided to try this one. After a 13hour flight from New Zealand we were please how easy it was to get the free shuttle from outside the LAX terminal to the Embassy suites. On arrival (8.30am) we were greeted by a helpful and friendly staff member who allowed us to check in to our room immediately, without any extra charge. The hotels decor is a bit tired and dated, but the rooms are very spacious and clean. The King bed suite has a large bathroom and an extra vanity in the bedroom, also a sitting area with small kitchenette (microwave, fridge, sink and coffee maker). Only problem I'm a tea drinker, no jug meant I had to use microwave to heat the water. Our room faced away from the airport and was very quiet.The bed was very comfortable. After freshening up we were ready to see some sights.We had heard about the Ocean Express bus (from a tripadvisor review) that goes to Manhattan Beach and 2 upmarket shopping centres which picks up from Century Blvd. We asked at reception and bought the tickets from there. Very cheap ($5) for round trip, get on and off all day/night. Manhattan beach is lovely, much nicer than up the coast (Venice, Santa Monica). At the hotel between 5.30-7.30pm there is the Manager's reception. This is a great way to relax after a day out, with free drinks and nibbles. We ate at the restaurant for dinner both nights as it was very reasonable and convenient. The buffet breakfast was good with everything you could want. We opted to go to Universal Studios on the 2nd day on our own. We caught the free shuttle back to the airport and then got on the FlyWay bus to Union Station ($7) then got the metro to Universal City ($1.50), then caught the free bus up the hill to Universal Studios. This was so cheap and easy to do and a bit of an experience, instead of sitting on a tour bus for hours, stopping at each hotel. This would also be an easy way to go to Hollywood as the metro stops there on the way. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I was doing a quick stop over in LA.

Reviews.Title: “how to escape canyon hell or what to do if you need to fly out to australia”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneDes
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Embassy Suites LAX North and we really enjoyed our visit. As we were going out the next day to australia we were able to get a real nice rate on a half day rate.. untl 600 pm and this helped because if we had to wait in the lax airport for our 8 pm flight we would have killed eachother. Waiting at LAX for an outgoing flight is analogous to having dental work done without an anesthetic. The suite was spacious, clean and the staff were helpful and thoughtful. Breakfast was great.. . I do have a minor complaint... in this area it is very hard to go out and do something...i asked the front desk and the male deskman recommended a nearby mall about 15 k's away....i spend the morning researching how to get out of canyon land (lax North) and found there were options taxi's rail or bus but they were either very expensive or time consuming....my partner snored as i research....i was totally exasperated.... when he woke at 2 we went to the front desk to ask where we could walk to ....the female person said why walk.. take the Ocean exrpess Trolley for 5 dollars ......This is a magical little trolley that stops in canyon land and ferries the bored and restless to manahattan beach and area retail places.....erkkk i should have asked the females on the desk instead of the males..and i could have gotten hair done and retail therepy before the flight....please tell the males on the desk to push the ocean express trolley at the front desk...it is a magical little service and i really enjoyed about an hour on manhatten beach before the long haul home.....we will stay at embassy suites again when we flyover ....it was well worth the rate and we enjoyed the option for extending our stay... cheers from down under

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing and next year, it will become even more amazing!”
Reviews.Author: futuremrsrobinson
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal at the Embassy and had to take it. Weâ€™re glad we did. The front desk staff was fantastic. The room was nice and spacious with plenty of towels and soaps. There was an HDTV in the living room and standard TV in the bedroom. The bed (the whole point of the hotel) was amazing and my fiancÃ©e and I slept wonderfully. The evening reception was great with free drinks (the alcoholic drinks are basic, but hey, theyâ€™re free) and snacks (nachos, chips, crackers, etc). The breakfast is served in the same area and was amazing with made to order omelets (my fiancÃ©e had mushrooms), bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, hash browns, fruit and plenty of other great foods. I used the hot tub and thought it was amazing. The pool area is very nice and well taken care of. There was some sort of Halloween event going on during our stay that got a little annoying around 9PM. The area around the pool entrance was packed and it was quite the challenge getting the door open at the pool entrance. Keep in mind; I was in a swimsuit so it was a little uncomfortable being around so many people. The event seemed like it was never going to end, luckily it did, but it was inconvenient to say the least. I know people celebrate Halloween, but when we check in at 4PM and itâ€™s still going at 10PM, thatâ€™s a bit much. It would have been better if the line to get in wasnâ€™t by the pool. This is not a common thing and Iâ€™m sure the hotel wasnâ€™t expecting it to be as noisy as it was. Hopefully, they control it better next year. While the party was a minor issue for me, when youâ€™re paying $100+ to stay at a hotel, you should be able to enjoy the hotel and its amenities (like the pool) without any problems. We used the business center to check into our flight the next day and it was nice, quiet, and free. The internet use is limited to a certain time (for obvious reasons) and can only be used for certain websites (like email). We didnâ€™t have a problem with any outside noise during our stay and slept incredibly well. This was one of the nicer hotels Iâ€™ve stayed in and probably the nicest that I paid for myself. When we return to California, we will be checking the rates here, to say the least. As long as they always remain competitive with the area, we will stay here again. Thanks for the great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place, paper thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: cschuten
Reviews.Content: The location in proximity to LAX is great. The hotel is nice for families because of the extra room. Beds were comfy and the breakfast buffet was included. Down side was the paper thin walls. Our "neighbors" came in at 3am and were really really loud. Front desk staff said they would handle it, which I'm sure they tried. But I have to say I didnt feel toooo bad being obnoxiously loud when I got up at 530am to leave for the airport. All of the staff were easy to deal with and I appreciated the laundry facility.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but had some issues.”
Reviews.Author: ricgib
Reviews.Content: I trveled The end of May 2010 and the beginning of June 2010 and stayed 7 nights in this hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 245pm and I do know that check-in is not until 3pm, but we asked the front desk lady if sh had any rooms ready for us since it was 15 minutes. She checkedand said that she had nothing ready and if we wanted to we could just leave our luggage with the bellman and go do something for the night and check in later. I told her my 2 year old will need a nap so I will wait till 3 and check in at that time so she could have a nap and we could then do something. she said okay. I checked back with her at 3, 3:15, 3:30 and 3:45 and she had nothing. I was finding this hard to believe since noone else was checking in in that time frame. You can't tell me you can't clean a room in 1 hour. So I sent my wife up to the counter to another guy at the desk to check-in and he had a room ready, so my wife motions to me and I come over and just as I get to the front desk the lady steps in and tells the guy that the room has not been cleaned yet. I am a little suspicous now. I got a two room suite through the Embassy suites website at a great rate of $89 a night and I think there were specific rooms they were going to stick me in. So I tell the guy all of this and tell him that I want to cancel my reservation now and all of sudden we have our room. The room was a beautiful 2 room suite and this kind of backs up what I was thinking. The other problem was that there was a wedding reception the first night we were there and there was no parking that we paid for in the parking garage. We had to park in a garage next door that was not ev en theirs. I thought it was pretty bad that would take my $20 a night to park for the garage and not guarantee me a spot. Outside of those two things the room was very clean and the breakfast was great. Something to be said for the pool. But, the overall business practices of this front desk lady and the garage has soured my wife and I on Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased!!!”
Reviews.Author: cat15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 2 nights after our vacation in Tahiti on our way back to Canada. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. We had no problem with airplane noise. The front desk staff are very helpful. Actually everyone, from the cleaners to the breakfast buffet staff were pleasant. The breakfast and coffee were delicious. The free transportaion from the airport is good and we were picked up at 5:30 AM for our return flight with no issues. The Hotel is due for an upgrade, so that will make it even better! My issue was not with the Hotel, but with taking advantage of the Hotel online prepaid booking and "thinking" that this was a good deal..Ha.. once I paid in full the rates DROPPED the next week.. I had paid in full already so too bad for me! I will not do that again. If you pay in FULL and the rate drops you should be able to take advantage of it. Next time I will just hold the reservation (at the published rate) and pay once I arrive. If the rate drops after I hold it, I can just change it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, convenient hotel with awesome service”
Reviews.Author: flymalie
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to stay at a hotel for one night before returning to Honolulu...didn't want to fight the L.A. traffic before heading to the airport so we looked @TripAdvisor and saw the Embassy Suites/LAX. It is rated very positively and I can confirm that this hotel IS everything you need! My kids LOVED the rooms as it was big, roomy, and clean! We were able to unwind from a long week @ Disney and after returning the car, we were able to enjoy the Manager's Reception while watch the Phillies defeat the Reds : ) The a.m. breakfast is totally awesome - free, made-to-order omelettes, oatmeal, pastries, fruits, etc., saved us some money! I would definitely, definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: bobbert1312
Reviews.Content: If you have meetings near LAX, this is THE place to stay. I was less than two miles from training and spent more time going through the morning buffet than getting to my destination.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value for the money”
Reviews.Author: bargaingirlsyosset
Reviews.Content: embassy suites lax north was the best hotel value in la. great amazing breakfasts, great service, immaculate rooms, pool, manager's reception - it had it all. very helpful to have a suite where our son could sleep on a very comfortable sofa bed and we could have our own room. great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stop-over hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidaying_Aussie
Reviews.Content: This hotel has spacious and well maintained suites, with very friendly and helpful staff. The wireless (which is an extra $9.95) works fine. A breakfast buffet is included but its let down by offering coffee in plastic cups. The $5 trolley bus ride to the Ocean and local stores is great value and the bus stop is very close to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at this hotel due to the great...”
Reviews.Author: INMS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to the great comments on trip advisor. The check in was very quick and was very nice. The rooms was clean and spacious. The manager evening special was great and they never ran out of food. The breakfast was delicious. The bed was very comfortable. Also the Aero Bistro food was tasty. There were no bed bugs. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: carsonconnect
Reviews.Content: We had a conference at Embassy Suites and the staff went over and beyond the call of duty. Our conference was small, only about 30 people, but the Embassy staff treated us just as if we were a party of 300. The inclusive package was extremely economical. The breakfast, lunch, and snack were delicious. The staff was extremely professional and attentive!! I highly recommend that you plan your next conference at Embassy Suites LAX-North!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Airport, spacious rooms, inconsistent service, Bug!”
Reviews.Author: Sunchaser252
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a ten day, 9 person, 8 hotel tour of California. We were two families traveling together with kids age 7-14. This hotel was our last stop before an early morning flight out of LAX. The check in process was smooth. The husbands went to return the cars while the kids and wifes checking into our rooms. The Lourdes, was extremely nice and helpful at check in. We were given rooms on two different floors as they were sold out for the night and couldn't get the two families close together. That was fine. When we got the luggage to the room I opened the door and woof, the smell of smoke was over powering. I called to the front desk and Lourdes moved me to the 8th floor. That room was smoke free. Throughout our stay we thouroughly checked our rooms for bedbugs before we brought our luggage in/unpacked. We looked at the mattresses and boxsprings and head boards. Both the mattress and box spring looked ok. The headboard was covered in a huge layer of dust on the back side. No bugs, no eggs, no casings, so we moved in. I got a call from my cousin in the other room to come see her mattress. It had a huge blood stain in the center of the mattress that the housekeepers had tried to clean but was still there and three pin dots of blood close to the edge of the mattress. We called the manager. He said the house keepers inspected the mattresses each time they clean a room and he didn't think this looked like a bedbug stain. (google bedbugs stains and they can look like pin dots of blood). My cousin wanted to move her room and they said they were sold out and couldn't move her. I said can't she go to the smoky room I just left? Yes, she could. She moved and opened the sliders. The smell was concentrated in the living room portion of the room, so they slept only in the bed room not on the couch. But this required she sleep with her two daughters (3 in a bed). Not a good night sleep. We ate in the hotel restaurant, service was painfully slow at 9pm with not many folks in the dining room. We decided the waiter must be cooking too. Food was ok, not bad, but I think we waited more than 35 minutes for the food to come out. We woke up at 4:30 showered and began to get dressed. I carried the hair dryer out of the bathroom to the additional sink outide the bathroom, turned on the overhead light and ..bed bug was crawling across the sink. I killed it and called the front desk. When we checked out I brought it to him in a plastic bag. He didn't seem too concerned, but proceeded to tell me about how his own house had just been treated for bedbugs and it was like something out of a horror movie. I asked that the hotel manager call me. Two days later I hadn't received a call and left another message. I called the next day again and spoke to the guest services manager who had been out sick and just returned back. Their response was they had an exterminator check the room and didn't see anything. Bed bugs can hide in box springs, wood furinture (there was a huge amoire in the room the would have been impossible to move and look behind as it was a builtin piece of cabinetry.) The guest services manager was supposed to call us back again and never did. If we hadn't seen the blood pin stains on the other mattress I might have assumed this the only one in the hotel. But the reaction from the morning desk clerk and the lack of response from management makes me think that this was not the only bug they ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Friendly...but Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Boys
Reviews.Content: OK...it's a hotel by an airport so what should I have expected? Later at night, there was a constant deep droning noise. Not quite sure if it was from the airport or from inside the building but that was almost more distracting than the airplanes taking off throughout the night (it was quieter at 8 am than it was at 1 am!), Thank goodness for Tylenol PM and that my son is a DJ and had extra sets of heavy-duty earplugs with him! The staff was wonderful and very, very friendly. Parking was an issue when the hotel was booked on the weekends so they adjusted the parking fee off our bill. There are parking spots within the property gates along the perimeter of the hotel where you can park before going down into the garage - not as convenient, but better than parking on the street or in another lot where they offered to cover the charge (although the neighboring lots are less expensive). The facility is fine, although showing signs of age. The blanket on the sleeper sofa in the living area was scuzzy, but the bedding in the bedroom was fine and those beds were comfortable. I tried sleeping on the sleeper sofa to get away from the noise from the outside, but it was too uncomfortable for me. We thought this location was going to be ideal due to the proximity to all the major roads, however, we had never experienced the LA freeways before! By the end of our trip, we were taking the city streets everywhere and avoiding the freeways! The majority of our sightseeing was north of the city (Hollywood, Burbank) so we should have stayed up in that area even if the hotels were more expensive. It was at least a 45 minute drive every morning due to traffic. There is a hefty charge for accessing the wifi in your room, however, you can use the computers and printer in the business center at no charge (not well-advertised). Breakfast is nice, but they clean up and close up right at 9 am on weekdays (not ideal if you have gotten in late the night before and want to sleep in a bit) and 10:30 on weekends. So for our family needs, this hotel was not the best choice. Spacious rooms, but didn't sleep well, difficult parking and too far from the sightseeing spots due to the traffic. Would not recommend for families here on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding facility with a great, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: EddyBusman
Reviews.Content: Hotel provided exactly what our group needed despite last minute changes. This Embassy Suites definitely exemplified a service-oriented lodging facility that emphasized the comfort of its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Conferences”
Reviews.Author: OuddaHere
Reviews.Content: We just held a luncheon for a professional group and we were very pleased with everything. Katherine Ko from Catering worked with us to put together a luncheon menu that met our tight budget and helped to make all of the arrangements. The location was very central. The room was spacious, clean and the acoustics were great. The food was good and parking was easy and they worked with us on pricing. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, pretty and useful premises.”
Reviews.Author: Maddog987123
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding reception at the Embassy Suites. The staff was helpful and professional, even helping us find vendors for other parts of the wedding. The prices were some of the best in town. It was very convenient to be so close to the airport and use the airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Embassy Stay”
Reviews.Author: VESmith25
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Embassy Suites on several occasions before catching an early flight out of LAX but in the future I will be selecting a different hotel. I found the cleanliness of my room to not be satisfactory as well as several things broken and badly worn. The walls are horribly thin between rooms so all night I heard the occupants of the room next door open and then slam drawers in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Noise Problems”
Reviews.Author: Tristate_Traveler001
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Embassy Suites LAX North with my family prior to an early flight home. Nobody slept as we had tremendous noise issues from two sources: (1) externally from flights taking off all night -- unlike many airport hotels at which we have happily stayed -- the windows here did not appear to be insulated for sound and the noise from departing jets was terrible; (2) internally from a family in the suite next door - i travel frequently on business and have never heard noise transmission like this. When the person in the neighborhing suite shut down their cellphone, my wife thought I had shut mine down instead. We could hear conversations from next door perfectly clearly.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way.”
Reviews.Author: lhorne00
Reviews.Content: I would like to take time to thank all the staff at embassy suites for job well done.

Reviews.Title: “A night to remember”
Reviews.Author: danieldiane
Reviews.Content: We received first class service from the Hotel, Restaurant/Catering Staff. All were very accomodating, professional, personable. The service they provided was well above the normal service. We truly had a night to remember, thanks to the entire staff at the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: simrocks64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel on arrival from UK. From the moment we stepped through the door the service was top notch. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff both at receeption and in the restaurant. Rooms very spacious and clean, breakfast great and drinks reception very welcome after a 10 hour flight. Would fully recommend to other travellers and look forward to staying here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: FranklinsFresno
Reviews.Content: My husband and I call this our home away from home although we only live 3.5 hours away, but have to visit L.A. often and this is were we stay every time... A great Breakfast included in the price. Because of the separate living area and bedroom, we can spead out. This is always our first choice and they always make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “50th wedding celebration & overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: travel20000
Reviews.Content: My parents celebrated their 50th year of marriage during the month of June. We searched for hotels, restaurants and halls that would meet our criteria. Obviously this was a momentous occassion and we wanted it to be special. Our main concern was that the venue & the people working their would support our enthusiasm. We were so pleased to be able to work with someone like Katherine Ko who is in charge of catering. She is a YES person. She didn't give away the farm but anything we asked she made every effort to make it happen and didn't show any signs of being put upon. That is so rare in todays business environment when many act as if they are doing you a favor when you are spending your hard earned money at their venue. Believe me, we had other choices but her favorable business attitude is what won us over. Our event is still spoken of several months later by the 200 guests that attended. Katherine (and apparently her staff) made sure our ball room was decorated beautifully, they were flexible in terms of the time that the food was served, she offered great advice... I could go on and on. We had a "free" nights stay with our event and the next morning as a guest of the hotel you are welcome to the "free" breakfast buffet which was vast & tasty. The chef who made the omelets was also nice to work with. I forget his name but I think it had a latin flavor, he is tall and bald. The atrium is quite lovely with its watefalls/greenery and offers an inviting social setting. Again, the most important part to us is that they were accommadating. Therefore I will be referring business to Embassy Suites LAX North and I will suggest that they ask for Katherine Ko or someone with her business sense and spirit.

Reviews.Title: “great experience for the family”
Reviews.Author: Oldtimer_from_philly
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself traveled with our granddaughter to visit our son and his family. We found the hotel very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the convenience of the complimentary breakfast and the indoor pool with whirlpool tub. The happy hour was relaxing to meet our family and enjoy some time before going to dinner. Overall we had a great experience and will certainly return again and tell recommend your hotel to our friends. t

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel18
Reviews.Content: I am a very understanding, easy going traveler but had to write this immediately to warn others. I have been booking hotel rooms for over twenty-five years and have never ran into the issue I had with Embassy Suites LAX North. I booked a room on May 18th for a stay on July 31st. I reserved an e-mail confirmation that my Room type was Non-Smoking Confirmed King bed with a preference for Non-Smoking two beds. The day before our stay I phoned the hotel because I saw on line that rooms with two queen beds were available. I was told by the person that I spoke to in reservations that I was changed to two queen beds Non-Smoking and was sent a new e-mail confirmation with the same confirmation number. Meaning the non-smoking confirmed was still part of the reservation. Upon arrival at the hotel I checked in and when we went to our assigned room found out it was a smoking king room. I spoke to the gentleman at the front desk about this and showed him my e-mail confirmation. He pointed out on the e-mail a sentence that read the following. Your room type preferences have been submitted with your reservation and are subject to hotel availability. He was very professional and gave me a discount on my room. I did not have a problem with the king bed since that is what I had originally booked. But I had a non smoking confirmed room according to my e-mail. In my dictionary the word confirmed means not subject to change. Obviously whoever oversees the running of this hotel does not know the meaning of the word or what is typed in the e-mails that are sent. In addition to being assigned a smoking room, the sleeper sofa frame was broken and the mattress partially fell through making it feel like you were camping on a hill. I have stayed at other Embassy Suites and Hilton Hotels but I can guarantee you I will never stay at one again! I specially read trip adviser for comments and wanted to make others aware. Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Vacatrip1
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for one night here before we left for the airport. Everything was as expected for an Embassy Suite property. The lighting in the room was a little dark. Other than that, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: MEGADAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night during a recent trip and I have pros and cons to report based on our experience. Pros- The shuttle was prompt picking us up at the airport. Check-In was fast and courteous The hotel lobby and exterior is very inviting and clean Indoor pool looked very nice Room, although dated, was spacious and offered several amenities(Room 509) Room service was prompt and reasonably priced Breakfast was sufficient in the morning with made to order eggs. The front desk was very helpful when we picked up our Rental Car and need to park for a little while before checking out. The Budget Rental Car is directly across the street from the hotel Cons The room was clean but dated. I don't know if other rooms have been updated. There was an extreme amount of noise coming in from the street. I am actually hearing impaired but the amount of traffic noise and airplane noise made it difficult to sleep soundly. We liked the Embassy Suites but the dated rooms and the noise level that we experienced would make me shop around next time before booking here again. We are Hilton Honors Members and choose this hotel for the points.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for a layover with young children”
Reviews.Author: Katrina70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on 2 separate nights when we were in transit from LA airport with 3 young children. There is a shuttle to and from the airport. The rooms are very adequate - we had 2 Queen size beds and a fold out couch in the living room. The beds are extremely comfortable, the room was quiet and the curtains blacked out the room very well - all the important things you need when in transit. We had a nice dinner meal in the hotel restaurant (with a children's menu) and a good buffet breakfast that is included in the nightly rate. Our children spent a very enjoyable few hours in the pool. The front desk staff were extremely helpful. We appreciated the tea and coffee making facilities. The only minor criticism I had is that the shampoo, body lotions etc smelled awful. On the whole though, we had a nice stay that was particularly good value for money

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Orangewithatwist
Reviews.Content: The staff is very nice, and helps you out in any situation. There is an indoor, heated pool and spa that is very nice. The pool is perfect for swimming laps or if you just want to splash around! The breakfast buffet is delicious! The rooms are comfortable and the hotel is in a very nice area to take a little stroll through! Perfect for families of all ages or for business. Although, the last time I stayed, we requested a non smoking room and you can smell smoke on the curtains, our doornob on the bathroom door was messed up, the towel racks were a little rusty, and the balcony's slider had alot of water/condensation on it! However, i would highly reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, economical, convenient”
Reviews.Author: poem19girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on June 7 after visiting with our daughter in LA and getting ready to fly to Hawaii the next morning. It was a good deal ($149 online) and is was a very large two room suite. Even though all of the rooms were centered around a middle courtyard, the bedroom was in the back and it was very quiet for sleeping. The omelet station for breakfast the next morning was great, the staff was polite and helpful, and there was a convenient shuttle every 15 or 20 minutes to get us to LAX. One of the better hotel deals around as far as I am concerned. I would definitely stay there again, especially if I needed to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stopover whilst connecting with your flight.”
Reviews.Author: mwpcschris
Reviews.Content: This was one of the last hotels I booked on our 5 week trip to the USA. It was an oversight that I actually forgot to book our final hotel out before flying to Australia. We flew in from Hawaii and the shuttle service was prompt. The check-in was seamless with very helpful staff. Our room was one of the best we stayed in on our visit. We had a room for ourselves in the dining area and the kids lounged on the beds watching TV. Room service was fast and very courteous. A highlight I never knew about was the Managers Reception where free drinks and snacks were available for 2 hours. My wife, children and I enjoyed soda, beer, wine and snacks whilst watching the world go by. For an airport hotel I highly recommend this property. Complimentary breakfast is served until 1030am which is a bonus. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: What great value for money. The suite is huge and very comfortable. Bedding was excellent including the sofa bed. Breakfast was one of the best we have had in the terms of quality, not selection(only basic, but very tasty). The service was fast and efficient. Check in at noon and we were given a room, no waiting. The shuttle was quick and reliable. Great location to airport and even tourist attractions. After checking in we walked up the road(2 minutes) to Avis and collected our car. Budget is right next door to the hotel. There is a $9.90 fee for the internet. I could not fault this hotel in any way, and will certainly return in the future

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NatsyLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and her 3 young children on a stopover. There is a free shuttle (shared with a couple of other hotels) from the airport to the hotel. The rooms are great. You can get a good size room with the Embassy Suites. We had a living room with a fold-out couch. This was separate from the bedroom which had two king beds. There is a microwave and fridge but there is nowhere nearby that I could see to purchase food to use them. There is a restaurant downstairs and the food is ok but not overly great value. They have a manager's reception in the early evening with drinks and nibbles which is good. We didn't try breakfast. There is a Buger King a couple of minutes walk around the corner but little else within walking distance. There is a pool but it is indoors so not great for hanging out for hours. This hotel would be better with an outdoor pool and if there were just a few more shops/restauants nearby but maybe this is not realistic for an airport hotel. There is a bus stop right outside and I took this to the Westfield Mall in Culver City. This took about 15-20 mins. It's not huge but they have some good shops and a couple of places to eat and also a Target which sells some food. Before that on the bus route is the Howard Hughes outside promenade/mall which has a few places to eat I believe. This is a good place to stay for a night or two but I would not recommend staying any longer, especially wih kids, because of the lack of nearby ammenities. This is probably true of all airport hotels though.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Mavros66
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nites..checkin was fast and efficient..the hotel is an "oasis" in the midst of busy & noisy LAX airport..our room was a 2 room type that was large ..comfortable.. with a king bed that was great .. the bedding was slightly worn as was the general condition of the room and hotel.. but does not detract from the overall experience of comfort ..cleanliness..and peace.. these are the hotel's main qualities...a full cooked buffet breakfast & happy hour that were included was a most welcome part of the price package.. for people without a car.. transport was very accessible ..whether ..the shuttle to the airport..trolley to the beaches.. or buses that were frequent & closeby in all a great stay..would I do it again?...MOST DEFINATELY.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Brazoo
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay at the Embassy Suites North LAX hotel. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 6th floor. The hotel is very convenient to LAX about 1 mile away and easily accessible with their own efficient shuttle service from the terminal area that runs back and forth about every 15min. We selected this hotel based our other TripAdvisor feedback again and found when searching for lodging near the airport that there really never seems to be a perfect hotel within striking distance of LAX but this one had enough positive reviews for me to roll the dice. Check in was interesting in that I secured a room at $183/night and was checked in and upon entering our room found my wifeâ€™s grandmother waiting in the living room of our room as she was going to be staying with us, and I was a little perplexed because I was wondering how she had access to the room considering I just checked in. Basically she checked into the room and they checked me in over the top of her check in on the same room which I had sole reservations for. Go figure but it worked out in the end. Outside the room areas are showing a little wear and could use a fresh coat of paint. Inside the room, we had 2 queen beds in back bedroom and we ordered a crib in that room for our 2 yr old. In the front room you have a table with chairs, side chair and a pull out bed couch. This area also holds the fridge and microwave which I prefer vs. being squired away and unavailable when someone is in the sleeping area, namely our 2 yr old. The bathroom is only accessible to the back bedroom which I think was an issue when you sharing with family cohabitating both back and front areas. Why no one figured out an easy solution such as a dual entry door to the bath is beyond me and my one major knock on the hotel. Our crew went down to the hotelâ€™s moderately priced restaurant Aero Bistro for a quick dinner. I had the BBQ chicken pizza and my wife the Mahi Mahi dish. Both were excellent, even the presentation of the dishes were more in line with an upper scale restaurant. The staff was attentive and interactive which made for a pleasant meal. Now the best part - after a 4 hr flight with a 2 yr old I was very happy to participate in the complementary manager happy hour that runs from 530pm-730pm. The drinks are not watered down and after 5 of them I was able to unwind from that flight. The staff hosting the festivities were very friendly and wanting to make sure all your needs were met. They kept running nachos and popcorn over to our table and were happy in the process. We also enjoyed the complementary full breakfast buffet the next morning before our flight to Mexico. Basically I think it is priced a little high but given what is included and what we took advantage of during our stay it turned into a fair value. It might be a total 5 star hotel but it is good enough to earn my repeat business next time I find myself passing through LAX for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large Rooms and an amazing breakfast and happy hour”
Reviews.Author: Dermab
Reviews.Content: Most Embassy Suites are known for the large space you get in your suite and this was was no exception. The hotel itself was vey pleasant with a large atrium like interior, elevators with views, etc. The happy hour was wonderful with free wine and beer (unusual) and the free breakfast involved cooked to order omelets. Self parking was not free but very convienient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free happy hour, decent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: krace168
Reviews.Content: This was one of the better Embassy Suites we have stayed at, even if the look and feel was a bit 'tired'. On choosing a hotel for our stay near LAX, we considered many options. I was certain that when I placed my booking that free internet was offered. Alas, when we got there, we discovered we had to pay for it. We already knew that parking was not free but we were a bit miffed to have to pay for internet in our room. The business centre does however provide free internet. The hotel provided a decent breakfast. Eggs and omelet cooked to order by a very nice chef. Bacon and sausage were not displayed as part of the buffet, but if you go and order eggs, you will be asked whether you want them. The rest of the buffet was the usual run-of-the-mill. If you want fresh hash browns, wait until you get your eggs. Don't go to the egg station with a plate that has food on it, you'll end up getting less bacon and sausage :) Happy hour at the hotel: 530-730pm. There were lots of people and drinks were really truly free. Tip your bartender accordingly. The attendants who put out the trail mix, nachos and popcorn did so sparingly and were constantly on hand to either replenish the food or admonish patrons. It was rather uncomfortable to have to be told off by them. We were sat on a sofa in an area right alongside the atrium, and he comes to tell us that we are not to spill anything there so as not to make more work for him. It was just bizarre. On a different day, and a different attendant, I overheard this guy scolding some children who were handling popcorn. In any case, the happy hour items did not change from day-to-day. Expect nachos, popcorn, trailmix, sodas other than the open bar. The room was roomy and comfortable, particularly the bed. We slept well. The proximity to LAX didn't deter us from rest. There was one flat screen TV in the main living area and one older model in the bedroom. Reception was not great but that was not as important to us. The bathroom could use some better planning. The bathtub was far from where the towels were. The floor will get wet before you get to your towel. In fact, my child did slip and fall in there. Be warned! My husband liked the fact that there was an additional sink in the bedroom. Also appreciated was the fridge/freezer in the room, and yet another sink at the 'bar' area. The airport shuttle came every 15-20 mins so I would say that was very convenient. The pool and fitness area were also good. We more than likely will stay here again even if we were briefly bothered by a few quirky things. The location is a winner. Parking here is a cinch. Remember to add wireless and parking fees to your room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: patt1010
Reviews.Content: Stayed on way out of town. The snack/drinks in the eve and free full breakfast are excellent. Very well done. Rooms were very clean and great to have a nice suite while on the road. Beds extremely comfortable. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: payingitforward1
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious. The pull-out was above average. The breakfast was insanely good. The evening cocktail offer was nice and they made shirley temples for the kids. The atrium was lovely. The wait staff was quick to tidy tables and pleasant. Distance to the airport was nominal. I could hear the planes at times, but not enough to loose sleep. The area was safe.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: IanAllan
Reviews.Content: Good airport transfer service. Room keys were ready and reception staff efficient; Breakfast in the restaurant finished a bit early for those suffering from jet lag .

Reviews.Title: “convenient and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JanSWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night after a long flight. Rooms are a little tired and didn't appear 'squeeky' clean but were ok. Plus of, course, loads of space. Bathroom could do with an upgrade. Bed was very comfortable and the breakfast was great. Staff were helpful, polite and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Free drinks!”
Reviews.Author: Scapegoat512b
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located about halfway down Century City on a sidestreet called Airport Way. Check-in was prompt and friendly, with what was new to me, complimentary beer and wine. The kids were refreshed with all they can drink soda, along with nachos and a few other finger snacks. The room was a two room suite (bedroom, living room) with a complimentary newspaper at the door in the morning. In the morning, a terrific, made to order omelet and hashbrowns along with several other breakfast goodies were again complimentary. We chose Embassy Suites because we needed the park, stay, and fly package. Our car stayed secure in thier underground garage for the week while we were gone on holiday.(parking included) The price was right in the middle of the competition, and now that I know I and my family can get some food and drink in makes it that much more of a value. The shuttle service to the airport runs promptly ever 20 minutes, around the clock.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Treenzs
Reviews.Content: Four of us travelling together got a room here and it was perfect for us. Beautiful spacy room - the beds were just out of this world comfortable and wonderful pillows too! Enjoyed the managers reception too which was complimentary nibbles and drinks in the evening. The pool and spa and exercise areas were beautiful! They provide free internet and business facilities which was great. They held our luggage for us during the day too since we had a late flight out that night. Great service. Easy getting the free shuttle to and from airport - was perfect for us as a landing point to then continue our journey the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely big suites with all facilities you need”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyCoventry
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights at the Embassy Suite Hotel at the end of February and being a lone traveller felt a bit nervous going to LA on my way back from New Zealand to the UK. But I need not have worried because the staff were brilliant - nothing was any trouble - and they were all ways pleasant and helpful from the reception to the bar and restuarant staff. The 'managers cocktails' early evening was a great way to meet and chat to people from all different locations. The rooms were excellent so big so I had plenty of room to spread around. There was everying there from iron to fridge what more could you want for a stop over, The breakfast was fine everything there to start your day off and again very relaxed and the staff helpful and pleasant.. The reception staff organised day trips for me to fill in the time and again were glad to sort it out for me. My only problem was with one of the trips I did with VIP Tours - things didn't go well and they agreed to give me a refund but to date after emailing them three times I have not heard from them which I find disgusting for a company of that size. Thankfully that has not hindered my opinion of Embassy Suites and would certainly recommend them to anyone staying over for a couple of days in LA. Thank you Embassy Suites for giving me four great days in LA and if I have to stop over again I will come back to you.

Reviews.Title: “This is was the best Embassy Suites I have been to.”
Reviews.Author: cvlrs2000
Reviews.Content: I took 85 band students this last week to the Embassy Suites LAX North. When we arrived all the rooms were assigned and ready for us to check in. Everything worked out very well. The staff was amazing. They always called me by name when seeing me. The rooms were always clean. The breakfast was great and they made it quick. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We travel every year with the band and always stay in a Embassy Suites. This is by far the best experience we have had staying overnight. thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: saleschick87
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because it is right next door to Budget car rental which allowed me to return my rental and walk next door then take the hotel shuttle to the airport the following morning. It's a nice clean hotel with big rooms. They offer a nightly managers reception with snacks and cocktails and they have a restaurant on site. I had dinner there and while it's not the largest selection the food was good...service was a little slow. My only minor complaint is that you hear a lot of street noise when in the bedroom. I had a 6 am flight so I went to bed pretty early and was awaken several times by buses, sirens...etc but I would assume its the same for all hotels in this area. You do have to pay for parking which I'm not a fan of at any hotel but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and reasonable on the weekends”
Reviews.Author: RyanfromIowa
Reviews.Content: We booked ahead and over the weekend so the price was great. Close to one of the bus tour companies. Close to some fun areas. Stay on the weekends and save.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem! I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: suitelife10
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long LA stay , what can I say about this location- its a great value. From the wonderful complimentary breakfast, amazing fresh omelettes to the manager's reception in the evenings - popcorn and beverages. I treated myself to one too many complimentary amaretto sours! I would like to compliment the latin gentlemen who made the omlettes 3/13-3/15 we were there at 6am and he was such a delight. I am truely sorry that I didn't get his name!!! Lourdes, a member of the front desk team provided excellent service. Slight disclaimer: I've lived in LA before so I do want to warn "travelers of color" that the latin staff is not equally welcoming to travelers of "color" in all instanves. we did have some servive issue with the front desk team and the make bartender- was unpleasant. During the manager's reception the male bartender carded only black guests and almost started something. On the opposite end of the spectrum was Eva the female bartender who carded every one equally, was a pleasure to see and friendly. The Suites are spacious, equipped with 2 flat screens, a budget car rental is right next door and remember this is a Hilton Hotel so use your Hilton honors membership for upgrades! There is a busness center but room wifi is not complimentary and is slow. There is also a spa pool, fitness center and regular pool- all in good condition. Aero is on the onsite restaurant and vab services is accessible. There is a liquore store around the corner ( within walking distance) and a weird homeless woman who has taken up residence near it (its right outside the main entrance on the side street) but that was the only oddity. A free shuttle service is offered to LAX and if you vall they will pick you up. Excellent value for the area!!! This hotel has the classic embassy Suites design and despite the minor service issues we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, convenient location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureDivers_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 35 others had the pleasure of staying at Embassy Suites North LAX in LA. This hotel was perfect for our group as we were overnighting on our way to Fiji. The hotel served up a great hot to order breakfast, helped us get on the trolley to Manhattan Beach and even stored our luggage for the day as we had a late flight out. Kelly the sales manager was excellent to work with making sure all our requests were met. When we came back from Fiji we overnighted again in LA. This was a nice break from such a long flight. The hotel checked us in earlier, offered us free snacks and beverages in the evening and even prepared a box breakfast for those leaving early in the morning prior to breakfast. If you are looking for a stop over hotel at LAX look no further Embassy Suites was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that offers much!”
Reviews.Author: WAKdog
Reviews.Content: Our large group (79 high school students, 41 adults) stayed at the Embassy Suites LAX North at the tail end of a mission trip to Mexico. We wanted a place to meet, relax and have a little fun, and we were not disappointed. The rooms were so spacious and nice, the breakfast was fabulous (everyone loved the selection), and there was plenty of room for our large group to meet and hang out. When we didn't have enough chairs in our meetting room, the hotel staff very quickly fixed the problem. The only problem we encountered was when my poor husband was sick with a cold and had to stay back (the rest of the group went to the beach and dinner). He tried to call for room service, but nobody ever answered the phone! But, aside from that, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Embassy - HUGE Rooms, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: h0tel_buyer
Reviews.Content: Embassy suites are great. The managers reception and the cooked to order breakfast is great. The hotel lacks many restaurants around, I think there is a burger king across the street but the restaurant in the hotel is great (a little pricey but not bad). The rooms are the typical embassy suites, very large, and great. If you have an early flight this is the place you want to stay. I have stayed here 3 times and always had great service and a prompt check-in. Just an all around great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “When you want more than a cubbyhole room”
Reviews.Author: bsalts
Reviews.Content: All embassy suites have larger rooms - perfect for traveling with your family or just need a place to spread out with computer and work - the suites are perfect. This particular location is close to teh airport - and across teh street with a rental car agency - (means you can pick up and drop off easily the same day and not pay for hotel parking). Nice free breakfast, and a friendly staff - make this a great LAX choice.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was most helpful and accomodating in organizing our stay.”
Reviews.Author: teacher613
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites staff helped to make the 9th grade class trip to Los Angeles a success. They were responsive to our needs and it made the lodging piece of the trip really easy. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel has it all”
Reviews.Author: jmapston
Reviews.Content: I have worked with the Embassy Suites LAX North for several years planning lots of meetings. The sales staff is great. esp. Kelly Wright!! The hotel offers breakfast and happy hour to its guests which is a real plus for us! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will continue to have meetings there.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good way to start the day!”
Reviews.Author: riverata
Reviews.Content: Nice big rooms, We love the Managers reception. Cocktails in the evening and breakfast in the morning. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Extra service, suite hotel at affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: srskier
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy the LAX Embassy Suite experience for the size of the rooms, open atrium, year round pool, managers reception & cooked to order breakfast, & location to all of So-Cal attractions. We ate at the restaurant this time, excellent food & outstanding service. I always enjoy how the wait staff remembers what you like.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: MariaMeschi
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here waiting for my niece to be born. The hotel is showing it's age a little, but everything was tidy and the staff were very nice, especially at the breakfast and cocktail receptions. We must have looked pathetic spending Christmas Eve in the hotel lobby, but everyone kept a smile on their faces and wished us a happy holiday. The omelets were a delicious departure from some other breakfast buffets I've been through. I would have appreciated free internet since they are an extended-stay property and my USB modem did not get a signal in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Good decent hotel, but watch out for room 816 (only a 1/2 room??)”
Reviews.Author: koalagurl
