Reviews.Content: We chose to stay down by LAX to avoid a long drive early in the morning for a 6am flight. Based on reviews and proximity we chose this hotel. Everything was actually pretty OK if not good; nice comfortable bed, pretty lobby, and a nice touch offering muffins, coffee and fruit even before the official breakfast was ready (we left the hotel at 4am for our flight, and the included breakfast doesn't start until 6am). We ate at the lobby restaurant, and that was pretty average. My complaint is the actual room we got. When I booked a room the description said a "king suite, non-smoking room." When we checked in we had a choice of a smoking king suite room, or a non-smoking "not quite a suite" room. We took the latter, and our non-suite room was more like a standard small hotel room with a long hallway leading to the room. This was clearly an "afterthought" room (as in, how can we squeeze one more room on the floor.) We were adjacent to a facility room (which probably is why our room was smaller.) There was a bracket on the wall where a hairdryer SHOULD be, and coffee packets and such where I assume a coffee maker SHOULD be? I really didn't mind the room, but I did mind paying the same amount that I should have paid for a regular "suite" room. Like I said, the rest of the hotel was fine, and the bed was comfy. I just felt a little slighted on paying full price for that particular room.

Reviews.Title: “Good size family suite close to LAX â€“ great breakfast includes”
Reviews.Author: journeydesigner
Reviews.Content: I booked our family of four in here for a one night stop because we were on a flight arriving late into LAX. I was surprised how quite it was in our room considering its close proximity to the airport. The room was spacious and clean and I liked the second vanity unit in the bedroom, which freed up the bathroom for showers. The complimentary breakfast supplied was great and I would have to say it was the best breakfast provided during our 33 day holiday in the US. We were also impressed with the free shuttle service provided from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience with parking”
Reviews.Author: TravelersMichigan
Reviews.Content: While this Embassy Suites was ok, it was not as nice as other Embassy Suites I have stayed in. The suite was a nice size for our family of 5, but the upholstered furniture was starting to show wear and tear and the bathroom was a little dirty. Nothing horrible, but nothing fabulous either. Internet was not free, but we could use the business center. Breakfast was great and had a made-to-order omelet section, fresh fruit, pastries, etc. Our biggest disappointment was with parking. We checked in very late and were told that the parking attached to the building may be full and we might have to park in a nearby lot. Indeed, there was no parking available, so we had to use the nearby lot. We were given a pass for it, but there was no map or clear directions to the lot. After finding it, we were confused on our directions back to the hotel and began walking the wrong way, not something you want to do at 1:00 a.m. in an area you aren't familiar with. Parking was $20, which was acceptable if it was available in the hotel but not when we had to walk to another lot.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: DeweyDelaware
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from New Zealand we stay 1 night here to rest up for our flight the next day to the East Coast. What I like the most was the FREE shuttle service from the airport. the Free 2 hour manager cocktail hour, the Free breakfest, the Free internet computers to use. which all was included in the price of the room. The only thing I see where they can improve on is the morning breakfast, They need to teach the cook how to make a better omelet . . Also would recommend their Bisto restaurant on site. We had dinner and it was very good. It was Just Right for the one Night!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: DerekM3
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, was there in 1992/3 and spent three weeks in one of the suites, it was great

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: christianson5
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel after a disastrous experience at a Ramada near LAX. A gentleman at the front desk was not very welcoming but none the less, the hotel was beautiful, the pool was well kept, the rooms were clean, the continental breakfast was amazing, and the manager's reception was a nice treat. It was a very comfortable hotel. One downfall was that even though there was a business centre, there was only 2 computers and they were ALWAYS in use and they block you from checking sites such as facebook.

Reviews.Title: “Very Suprised”
Reviews.Author: Conk99
Reviews.Content: Last minute trip to LA this summer, it was so late when we landed we elected to stay at the Embassy Suites North hotel next near our rental car agency. Not only were the rooms clean and spacious, the rate of $113 per night included free cocktails and breakfast the next morning. Every where I walked inside the hotel there were people cleaning and painting to keep the hotel in excellent condition. We were tired and the rate got us there, but I was truly suprised how nice the hotel was. Paid $300 plus many times at a beach hotel only to have a small room that is dirty. Congrats to this hotel, i will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennyf2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wkd trip to LAX--we spent 1 night at the Embassy & it was great! The staff was fantastic & the room was perfect. I checked out yesterday & cannot find my camera, I called & no luck. SO if you find a camera in room 714 please call :) Thank You!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, roomy, good as Airport Hotels go”
Reviews.Author: CasaMurguia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel based on an 18 hour journey from Ireland to LA, great idea just to get your head down with the kids after the trip. I would agree with a previous reviewer whereby it a nondescript both externally and internally. The Check in was fine, fast and the booking was as booked. As with any Embassy Suites they were big enough with all the normal things like TVâ€™s and microwave etc. Breakfast was included in room price and a very good selection of fresh fruit at buffet and cooked foods as normal, the kids got a great kick out of the staff and the attitude which was excellent to our young travellers. My only grip really was around the BAR, they were very attentive but they charged me $5 for a cup of Hot Water, I would guess the facility is outsourced but hey the charge was a bit of a rip off. Overall it was a good basic hotel and well worth the rate for LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: aucklandflower
Reviews.Content: Nice large TV. Roomy. Having a suite really makes a difference! Microwave & fridge. Good breakfast. Nice evening reception. Helpful staff. Good free internet in the business center - but had to wait around for a while. No noise from planes. Lots of children on the weekend - a bit noisy. Try to stay at a higher level. I had 2 crying babies next door on my first night. Unfortunately... No free internet in the room - have to pay $10 if you want to use it. Would stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel yet!”
Reviews.Author: thelilone
Reviews.Content: For being a middle class citizen and apart of the military ive had the privelage to travel all around. This hotel has proven to be most accomadating and affordable. There's a lovely outdoor scenery built inside with a calm and relaxing atmosphere. The rooms were clean and spacious. The pool and hot tub was most enjoyable. My only problems were with uptight guests and there lack of manners and respect for personal space. Thats just america today! I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: private1_90732
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel based on business activity location. Its quite nondescript externally. Check in was prompt, reservation was accurate. Rooms were well equipped, even flat screen TV, everything was functioning. Bed was comfortable. View was of another building externally and through the internal windows of the room the balcony rail was the only view! The atrium like construction is rather basic, uninspired and no design flair in my opinion. Its functional and seems rather basic. Breakfast was included in room price and a very good selection of fresh fruit at buffet was available. I had to line up for hot breakfast which reminded me more of Dennys both in food quality and presentation (average). Service from staff was excellent throughout the hotel and the front desk staff were especially good. Overall its an average basic hotel and not worth the rate that I paid for the convenience of proximity to a short-term business location. I can get better value at other adjacent local hotels such as Crowne Plaza, Sheraton and Weston.

Reviews.Title: “Property is in terrible condition- Not in the Hilton Category”
Reviews.Author: ludiandrade
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night 1-20-2009 - pre-cruise to Hawaii at The Embassy Suites North LAX. We always select an Embassy Suites when traveling as it guarantees a safe and clean environment - NOT THIS TIME! This property offers shuttle service to and from LAX airport which is convenient. Although we are Hilton Honor Members and reserved and pre-paid in full early Dec 2008, they did not have the King room requested available and offered a double arrangement. Their excuse: late arrival. Never heard of this before at this type of establishment. Staff was not rude and attempted to accomodate us. Strangely a King suite was found and keys were issued. Upon arrival to our room 522, we discovered it was a special assistance suite in addition to a connecting room. We were so tired we decided not to discuss the issue with the staff but would deal with Hilton upon our return. The room was a two-suite as expected but the furniture, carpet, lamps, etc appeared to be 30 years old - old and dirty - disgustinly dirty! Surely not of Hilton standard. Electrical wires in the bedroom entertainment center were exposed. Drapes were in need of repair or better yet, complete replacement. The bathroom had filth on the walls - don't know what that brown stain was on the door. Ceiling above shower showed a shotty plastering job - yellow, bulging and disgusting. The sink and tub leaked all night! Needless to say, we did not use the shower but waited to shower onboard our ship instead. The property is in a rundown - or at least looks like- area. Four Points is across the street and from the outside looks in the same condition. THe next morning we attempted breakfast - served from 6am-9:30am. This was good. Service was good and area was clean. This property must be vamped up to the year 2009 and cleaned up. I do not recommend this property especially if traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel not so great”
Reviews.Author: WI_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The location on this hotel is great, just minutes from LAX. The shuttle runs 24 hours, every 15/20 min. The shuttle ride was only about 10 minutes to the airport. The service was great, and there are free drinks and snacks in the lobby every night. The rooms were spacious, with a balcony, but mine was somewhat musty smelling. The onsite restaurant was kind of disapointing, with limited choices. Overall, for the price ($200) it was ok, but not great. Also, the internet was a 9.95 per day charge.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: AussieMike2
Reviews.Content: Convenient to airport, clean, not noisy, pleasant decor and breakfast included in tarriff. Restaurant a little slow the night we were there but food was excellent. Just the spot if you are in transit with a couple of days to spare and dont want to travel all the way into town. We spent and afternoon at Venice Beach and the next day at Disneyland then came back to the hotel to shower, change and fly off

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly & Good Venue to Stage a Family Event”
Reviews.Author: MinnFrequentTraveler
Reviews.Content: My nephew was married at the hotel, and the large majority of the guests stayed here - some of us, for the entire weekend. The staff was very friendly, the place very clean - rooms and common areas. They do a great deal for happy hour, and the food from the bar/restaurant is good. I wasn't thrilled that it was going to be held at an Embassy Suites, but was very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “OK but some problems”
Reviews.Author: chufa
Reviews.Content: OK hotel room: all suites (living room and bedroom) Big problems with breakfast - small breakfast room, slow service and long waiting Suitable for passengers with family or business travelers in transit Reasonable clean Very noisy Must pay for parking

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: abraddock
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a family of four at the start of our holiday touring the national parks and further north. Friendly staff, good breakfast but do get down quite early to avoid rush, free access to computer and internet in business room. The corner suite was ideal but do check wording we thought we had two sofa beds, one in our room as well as one in living room, however not the case. Good value bus shuttle through the day to Manhattan Beach well worth doing. VIP tours also good located nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: SpencerLV
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers, long-time members of Hilton HHonors, and usually love Embassy Suites and have stayed at a countless number of their hotels. I am very disappointed to say that this is the first time we had a terrible stay. Check-in was fine, and since this was a one night stay before an early flight the next morning, we opted for a cheaper, "non-suite" room. It was oddly placed in the far back corner on one of the floors, and it looked like it was put there as an afterthought, across from a noisy janitor closet/utility area. Although the hotel is non-smoking, the room smelled like a smoker stayed there and took liberties breaking the rules, so we called the front desk and they moved us to another room and gave us a free upgrade to a suite. In the second room, the floors were a bit dirty, but we thought we could endure given the short duration of the stay until we went into the bathroom: there was a large hole in the wall where someone kicked or punched it in, and the tub was *disgusting*. It had little black dots all over it, like someone had spilled a bag of charcoal and didn't clean it up. We were so grossed out we immediately called the front desk and moved to another room. It too wasn't terribly clean but it was adequate enough to stay put as we were tired of shuffling around at that point (after 9:30pm). All three rooms and the hotel in general are in sore need of updating. Bathroom fixtures were rusted and loose, the carpets were very old and tired, and the pickled oak furniture was outdated and beaten up. The sitting room in the third room we were put in didn't have a coffee table, while there was one in the second room, and the sofas and chairs had seen much better days. The elevators were dirty - someone had spilled food and it wasn't cleaned, at least as long as we were there. I have to admit that I didn't sleep well, worrying half the night that I would get bedbugs or worse from that room! I will give credit where it's due, the staff was friendly and the restaurant and waiter were quite good. But we noticed that the clientele was... how can I put this nicely... were very loud, noisy, no control over kids - more of the 1-2 star hotel guest variety - and that was shocking as all the Embassy Suites we've stayed in were quiet and catered to more polite, quiet, business or well-behaved family types. Staff made no attempt to remind guests to control themselves or their kids, and the pool area was overrun and the business center was full of pre-teens surfing the web. Considering how many hotels there are in the LAX vicinity, this Embassy Suites really needs to get its act together, renovate, and clean up in order to keep up with its namesake brand and retain customer loyalty. We, on the other had, will be looking for another LAX hotel for next time and strongly suggest anyone else do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tosham
Reviews.Content: My experience here could not have been better. The late check-in went flawlessly, the parking garage was ample with covered parking and in/out access. The location was close to the airport, but I didnt hear not one plane while resting/sleeping. Let me tell when they say cook to order breakfast....it IS cook to order!! I mean, u have so many choices!!! Omlettes, pancakes, waffles, french toast, fruits, muffins, sausages, bacon, oatmeal, .,..you get the idea!!! The reception in the evening is also nice...they provide chips, dips and a free, (2 drink maximum) bar! The pool area is inside with a hot tub and the fitness room looks nice. I didnt go in there because I was 2 busy eating!!! LOL...I will definitely make this my hotel upon returning! We had one altercation when our room did not get cleaned during one day, but the management gave us a good bit off of our bill and had housekeeping clean as quick and efficient as they could...so, no one is perfect, but at least the management is on top of things to make it right!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: We booked our room several months ago to assure a vacancy at this ever-popular establishment, located at the juncture of several airport hotels. Since everyone seems to know the attraction of the ES, there is no need to elaborate. Suffice to say, we were a bit apprehensive given two extremely negative reviews about servivce, maintenance, upkeep. In fact, I wrote a general letter of concern to Embassy Suites and was amazed, a few days later, that Mr. Lester, assistant general manager to this property, replied! He had read the complaints and would do everything possible to improve on the situation. What professionalism! And he kept his word. I should point out that we were not given any priority treatment or any kind of bonus. We were treated with the respect that any client should receive. That began at check-in and ended at check-out. All questions were answered accurately and courteously. Our transfers to and from LAX were also handled professionally. Our rooms were the standard two-room suite configuration and were clean and quiet. Even so, we always bring along earplugs just in case of unwanted noise later. The drinks at Happy Hour were well made and poured and the nachos, chips and dip, popcorn sufficient finger food. I like the atrium's appearance and the sufficient number of tables, even on a busy afternoon. Tables and the area were kept clean. At breakfast, omelets were made to order, although there were no sausages as might be found at other properties. No problem with that. There was also plenty of fresh fruit, juice, coffee, cereal, breads. There was never any problem with noise. The only problems we encountered--and I have subsequently notified Mr. Lester of this--was the absence of items on the menu for dinner at the Century Cafe restaurant. For example, there was no fish for the fish tacos, although by asking for ahi (tuna) to be substituted, one could get this dish. But the service was excellent and reflected careful attention to details. We still enjoyed ourselves quite well. One of the things Mr. Lester asked us to do when staying here was to keep an open mind and judge for ourselves the level of quality. Thank you, sir, for that advice. We should all apply that when staying at any lodging. I also recommend that anyone viewing a slue of negative reviews write the management. If she/he responds, this is a good sign that whatever problems were present might very well be handled by the time of one's arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: june47
Reviews.Content: If I could give zero I would! Absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were an okay size but had a horrible droning noise in them. Food at the hotel restaurant included reheated frozen scallops and uncooked cauliflower. We were unable to eat it. Absolutely vile. Sheets appeared dirty. Disappointing breakfast. Terrible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: colinl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of our 8 day trip to CA, unfortunately this was a big mistake. There were a catalogue of problems; The first room that we had was facing the main road and was very noisy, far too noisy to sleep in, we were then moved to another room and this was not suitable as all the rooms on one side of the hotel get noise from either the cooling tower or the kitchen. We were finally given a room that was not noisy, but in the process of finding this room we were shown a room with guests already in bed! We were compensated with $100 food voucher, unfortunately the food was deep fried and inedible. This is not what we have come to expect from a Hilton family hotel, if possible stay at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay for the right price”
Reviews.Author: Yankdo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed atthe Embassy Suites North at LAX. We had to stay for 2 nights to visit family in LA before boarding a cruise ship in San Pedro (port of los angeles). We were travelling with 2 teenage children so wanted the two room suite and breakfast buffet option. We got a rate of 125.00 for first night and 139.00 for second night through AAA which I thought was good for the amount of space. 2 queen beds and 1 pull out couch. We arrived at 11 pm and found the hotel shuttle right outside from the baggage carousel. Make sure you are getting on the Embassy suites LAX NORTH shuttle as there is another embassy suites LAX South which is confusing. The shuttle we took also serviced the Marriott which I found odd but perhaps it was the late evening arrival. Even with a stop at the Marriott first it only took 5 to 7 minutes to be delivered right to the front door of the hotel. Check in was very easy but we had missed the food room service hours and they did not serve any food at the restaurant or room service after 11 pm. I thought I had read that they had 24 hour room service so my hubby was not happy. they did have a little market and he bought some really gross burritos and even grosser cheese pizzas for the kids to microwave in the room -- $38.00 dollars worth to be exact. We were on the second floor which was pretty easy but now about the room. Just know that the first impression of the room was really not good and I was wanting to ask for another room but as mentioned above I had a very hungry and tired family who had been fllying for 8 hours and were still dealing with the time change which made it like 4 am so we settled for what we were given. The rug was musty smelling and there was a 24 inch diameter red stain on the rug in the bedroom. The tub in the bathroom looked oldish and scratched and never looked as though it had been cleaned. Just tired and old finish I think. The linens and beds were clean and exceptionally comfortable. The rooms and the bathroom were very spacious and the balcony was huge although there were sandbags at the slider (this may account for the musty/damp smell) and no chairs out on the balcony. There wasn't much reason to sit outside but a chair would be nice. The kitchenette area had a small fridge, tiny microwave and coffeemaker. and small stainless sink. There was a table and chairs for 4 for dining, however, there were no utensils or silverware. They did provide papertowels so we used it for plates to serve the gross pizza. We stayed on a Saturday night and we now realize there must have been a wedding or function earlier on Saturday because the party noise continued all and I mean ALL night long. We did not hear any noise from the street or the airport/planes but the walls were paper thin. There was a bunch of girls next door who stayed up all night long laughing and singing and Banging the doors shut. This is how thin the walls are -- everytime someone would close/bang the door shut next door, our headboard would shutter and shake with so much movement as to wake you up even if you had somehow managed to doze off a bit. Again we were so exhausted that we did not want to move our room and just put up with it. To tell the truth we were also a bit intimidated by the numbers of partyers and did not want to antagonize any drunks. The next morning there was trash everywhere in front of our room with dirty cups/glasses. The breakfast made up for a lot. It was huge with lots of choices and lots of fruit, pastries, eggs, sausage and a made to order omelette station. We rented a car for the day from Budget which is directly across the street. That was really handy to just leave the car off and run across the street the same night. We needed a ride out to the cruise ship pier and the girl at the front desk was very helpful. We used Super Shuttle and were able to get picked up right from the hotel and taken directly by van to the San Pedro pier. $69.00 for 4 people with all our luggage. We were told that a cab could run at least 80 before tip so the Super Shuttle was great. We also reserved them to pick us up at the dock on the ship's return and that was $68.00 for 4 and very efficient. OK back to the hotel -- overall the hotel was a little on the shabby side not what you'd expect from the Hilton chain but the location was excellent, the breakfast buffett was excellent , the pool area was clean and nice, and oh yes the boys had dinner in the century restaurant down stairs and the food was very good and fair priced for hotel food, and the rooms and bathroom were spacious. If you can get the right price this place is really not a bad choice especially if you need the space. Almost forgot -- the wifi was $9.95 for 24 hours. We had trouble getting the wi ficonnection to work and had to call GTS ourselves which was a pain. If I had been there for business I would have been quite annoyed. I think in this day and age it is really ridiculous to charge for wi/fi. It's like charging for basic cable TV.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Daffyfam
Reviews.Content: We had a suite since we had six family members. The room was quite, clean and well taken care of. The room didn't smell like your typical "hotel room" it was much better. The down side was that you were charged extra to use the internet and it didn't work well. We had two laptops, a Dell and Apple so it wasn't our computers. They had to give us several codes before it worked properly. The pool was very nice and clean. The breakfast was really good,and we found the gift shop with better deals than some of the local stores. We stayed there primarily because they were on a list for Starline tours which provided shuttles to and fro. After checking out we stored our luggage in our van during the tour with no extra charge for parking. Our van and articles were safe in their secured parking garage. If I ever return to LA., I would definately stay again. It is a little pricey but again, you get what you pay for. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “great 1 night stay for early LAX flight”
Reviews.Author: anotherbusinesstrip
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for a short stay if you are flying in or out of LAX. Rooms are fairly spacious, King bed is very soft and comfortable with the pillowtop. The hotel is SURPRISINGLY quiet considering I was on 2nd floor with cars, trucks and buses rumbling by right outside, not to mention planes taking off and coming in on final approach. Once the sliding door to the very small terrace was closed, I didn't hear a thing. Free drinks nightly for everyone at the manager's reception with some light snacks as well. Breakfast was fast and good. Shuttle bus to the airport (3-4 minute ride) runs every 15 mniutes. I paid $199 after booking at the last minute. I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: BernieMaggie
Reviews.Content: I checked in with several bags on the trolley, was provided my two rooms, and was assured they were connecting. Took the elevator up to the sixth floor or so with the bags, opened the door to one of the rooms....and discovered they were not connecting! Shortly after this discovery, the young man who had checked me in entered the room, I figured he was going to move me to connectors. Actually, he was there to see if I was finished with the trolley, as they were in short supply. I informed him of the connector problem, and he informed me he could get me a connector, but one of the rooms would be much smaller; he then showed me this configuration. I said I'd meet him at the front desk to change. I hauled all the bags back down to the front desk, where another couple was not happy about the lack of baggage trolleys. They had had enough, and decided to cancel. I decided on a third room configuration for my gang, which I was assured had connectors. We made the arrangements, and I hauled the bags up to a high floor again. I got to the rooms, and they were not connecting! I, as well, had had enough, and cancelled and moved to another hotel, just around the corner, where the experience was much different, and service and accomodations were exceptional. From my very brief experience at this Embassy Suites, it appears that they may be understaffed. The rooms and the property are IMHO tired and not fresh and bright. I would not consider this property again unless the property underwent a significant upgrade, and we are fairly frequent Hilton guests.

Reviews.Title: “One night ... rooms tired but fine ... but leave enough time for the flights !”
Reviews.Author: andrewsydney
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here before an early morning flight to Denver from LAX. We dropped off our rental car at Hertz who took us to the hotel, which is very close. The rooms are spacious but tired. The breakfast was great, with freshly cooked pancakes and omelettes a treat! If we need a LAX hotel again we would use this one. One note of caution - the shuttle to the airport goes every 15 minutes. It took us another 25 minutes to get to our terminal (United). The front desk the morning before quoted us about 10 minutes. Be careful - leave yourself enough time. We had plenty spare and were travelling very early so avoided the worst of the traffic but be careful!

Reviews.Title: “nothing to complain with”
Reviews.Author: Monpetit
Reviews.Content: For our last night in LA, after 5 first at the westin bonaventure(so, so...) and a night in Death valley, we choose the Embassy suite to be near airport and so to be "cool" the day of departure. The room(a corner suite) is very large and very well furnished. The traffic is high till 11 pm but after it's quite and the night has been good for the three of us. The complimentary breakfast offers a lot(even "Ã  la demande" omelette for those who want...). So an adress to highly recommand The diner at the restaurant(shrimp cocktail for 3,ravioli-steak and hot wings-chocolate mousse cake and creme brulee) was perfect. Erik

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: heretodaygonetomorrow
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we've stayed at any Embassy Suites hotel and it won't be the last. Terrific service, comfortable rooms (very large bedroom), a kiosk where you can check in to your flight if you're flying out the next day as we were, good food (breakfast especially so), express checkout, and close to all rental car drop off locations. And the kids loved the room service. Surprisingly affordable too!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Facilities Spolit By A Rude Desk Staff Posture”
Reviews.Author: CASTELMAR1
Reviews.Content: We selected this Hotel because its convenient location near LAX Int'l Airport. We were given a very large room, quiet, rather clean (except the worn carpet), with 2 king beds (our request was for a queen bed) Good points: The room, which was very hot at our arrival revealed an A/C breakdown which was rather quickly and well repaired. The breakfast is generous and good, with attentive service provided. The room service is acceptable. The shuttle service is convenient and frequent, chauffeured by a smiling person.Therefore, our stay would have been OK if we were not gratified with a RUDE WELCOME BY THE DESK STAFF: our car well parked near the front door has to be moved IMMEDIATELY, even before having time enough to put our luggage in the room. No welcome of any kind from the unsmiling and desinterested desk people (the desk clerk was occupied in training a new assistant, and therefore seemed disturbed by our venue). All requests we kindly made (miles on our fidelity card, description of the room proposed, map of the local area, location of the L.A. Museum of Contemporary Art, the famous "MOCA") were answered negative!y, or more often just by a simple word: NO! "(Ooh, what peaceful the Customer Service would be if there were never any Client coming"! is likely to be the policy observed by the desk staff). As a kind of confirmation of what is said above, the check out was again very poor (no answer when we said "Good Morning", nor "Please" nor "Thank You"!), with a wrong billing of 2 parking fees (16$/night), adjusted on request without any kind of apology. CONCLUSION :HOTEL OFFERING GOOD FACILITIES, SPOILT BY AN INACCEPTABLE AND UNPLEASANT DESK STAFF POSTURE. Mr HILTON Please put a notice panelled above the front desk and saying : SMILING DOESN'T CAUSE ANY HEAVY DESEASE, Please do train your desk staff and improve deeply their customer service ability, Do it for your new clients, because as far as we are concerned, we shall NEVER come back again in this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: turtleholidaycat
Reviews.Content: we chose to stay at embassy suites for our first night after flying to los angeles as it was very close to the hertz rental site. The staff were very polite and the room was spacious and clean. The in room service food was delicious. All in all an enjoyable place to stay and very convenient to the airport. I would be happy to recommend it to anyone and will return there again when we fly to los angeles in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Close, nice, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RoadTrip19Mom
Reviews.Content: -Better than continental breakfast: had eggs, bacon, and pancakes available (come before 15 minutes of closing.) -Large suites; nice appointments. -Responsive staff. -Frequent shuttle to airport. (every fifteen minutes.) -You could walk to airport, if you wanted. -We stayed here our last night in LA, dropped off rental car night before, and walked the few blocks (under 5) back from Avis. They would have picked us up via shuttle if we called and waited 15 minutes or less. -Nice enough pool; gives you something to do while waiting for afternoon flight. -They let us check out an hour later; very convenient. -Nice looking atrium. Loud enough AC, while it lets you sleep you yet can't hear nearby airport noise or atrium noise. -While everything quite clean, sink and its cabinetry a little worn.

Reviews.Title: “Great value overnight at lax”
Reviews.Author: scary_pineapple
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed overnight during an overnight stop-over at LAX. It was very good with a spacious room and free breakfast. The trip to the terminal was very short. We stayed there again on the way home. The pool is also a nice distraction for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “So-So hotel”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night of July 3 at this property in order to catch a flight early on the 4th. We arrived late and were able to check in easily. The parking lot is under the hotel and we were able to find parking easily. The room was a typical Embassy Suites set up. Frankly, there was nothing remarkable about the room. It wasn't the lap of luxury, but it wasn't a dump either. If you've stayed at Embassy Suites before, there'll be no surprises. Our one complaint was the smell in the room. It was rather musty. And no matter how high or low we adjusted the thermostat, the room just recycled air without heating or cooling it. Our departing flight left so early that we missed the breakfast, so I can't comment on the food. Would I return to this hotel when staying at LAX? Probably not. We found both the Hilton Garden Inn and Doubletree (both located to the south of LAX) to be far superior hotels for the same or lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with free shuttle to Manhattan beach nearby”
Reviews.Author: smgapp
Reviews.Content: Two in our group of three had early flights so we stayed at this hotel the last night of our LA trip. It worked out great that we had a two room suite and the two with the early flight could get up, shower and dress without waking the third in our group (me) who was sleeping on the living room sofa bed. The hotel has a really good hot breakfast buffet that is included in the room price. If you have an early flight before the buffet starts, you can request a breakfast to go the night before- but you have to ask for the breakfast- one hotel clerk knew nothing about it. The "togo" breakfast was fruit, a muffin and granola bar.There is a free hourly trolley shuttle one block away that I took to Manhattan beach- it is about a 20 min ride. I also saw that there is a public bus near the hotel that goes to Santa Monica but I did not take that bus. When I came back from Manhattan beach, I grabbed my bags and took the hotel's free shuttle to the airport (about a 5 minute ride and the shuttle leaves every 15 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Parking was a significant problem”
Reviews.Author: With2Kids014
Reviews.Content: I wish I had seen the review regarding parking being a potential issue for some travelers. If I had been informed by the hotel website when I booked that they had limited parking in their single floor parking garage and used another garage on the same block for "overflow" parking, I would not have booked here. As it turned out I lost time looking for a space in the hotel garage before being directed to the overflow garage. Unfortunately the overflow garage was fenced in. This made it difficult to find an exit for my young children (4 and 6 year-old) and me to walk through with our luggage. We then had to walk through a poorly lit alley behind the hotel to reach the front lobby. I would not have agreed to this for my family if I had known ahead of time. I did not feel safe. It would not have been as much of an issue for me as a single person. Although I received "complimentary" parking, a member of management was not on site to provide me with any further compensation. Overall, we lost an hour of time searching the original garage, finding the overflow garage, finding our way out of the overflow garage, and getting to the lobby to finally check-in! Unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Madagascar77
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LA from England late afternoon and wanted a stop off before travelling on to San Diego the next day, so booked the Embassy Suites after reading reviews on here. We found it friendly, clean and spacious, with a lovely breakfast which set us up nicely for the day. The free shuttle from the airport was very quick, and the next morning when we asked if we could be taken to the car hire offices (which are not in the airport grounds) this was no problem. For value and convenience, we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, lots of room good free food”
Reviews.Author: miniwalt
Reviews.Content: My wife and two teen age daughters stayed here for two nights while visiting Loyola Marymount University. We had two queen beds and a double fold out. The suite contained three sinks, a microwave, and refrigerator. The wifi internet worked very well, but there was a charge for 24 hours of about $5. The three rooms including bath, were large but somewhat dark. The bedroom had a sliding glass door which could be fully opened if you wanted to listen to the airport which was just a couple blocks away. We all enjoyed the free cooked to order breakfasts and the manager reception each evening, where they would provide free cocktail, nachos and popcorn. The place was clean and pleasant. The indoor pool looked like it would be a lot of fun for parents with younger children. If you are visiting Loyola, tell them and they will give you a promo code which will save you a few buck.

Reviews.Title: “Decent.”
Reviews.Author: Madam_G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Queen Suite (2 beds) on the 8th flr. Room and bathroom are large, clean, but not immaculate. Carpet had soils here and there. Balcony had the view of the runway. Walls are thin, we used foam earplugs and I could still hear the planes landing. Bed was comfortable, but not heavenly. The breakfast had a great selection. Eggs/omelettes made to order, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast, fresh fruits, cereals, muffins, toast and your usual breakfast drinks. The manager's reception had free alcohol and snacks; popcorn, chips, party mix. The underground covered parking wasn't too bad either. If the lot was full, the attendant will park your car for you. 2nd flr is where the coin laundrymatte is located. Only 2 washers/2 dryers. A dollar each. One dryer didn't work too well. The indoor pool is loaded with clorine. The jacuzzi looked really cloudy, yikes! It's also quite noisy on the weekends, there were a lot of teenage kids so it gets pretty loud at night and especially during the breakfast hours. Overall, it was an okay hotel. The only saving grace was the free breakfast and drinks; however, in the future, I will probably look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: DESERTCanterbury
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel. We have stayed quite a few times. Good if you are a family and want space. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: DKFAN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice - January and February. The rooms at this Embassy Suites were very nice. They are much larger than I expected. I've stayed in both the King Size and Two Queen bed rooms. Setup is almost the same in each room. Lots of mirrors in each room, which was very important for 4 women sharing. Nice dining area, refridgerator, microwave and coffee maker. 27 Inch TV provided in living room area and bedroom. The bathrooms are nice and big! They have an indoor pool and small business room They should put a time limit on the use of their two computers. Small, but nice exercise room. They have a convenient store to buy water, sodas, ice cream and traveling essentuals. They have a great Happy Hour! They also have an onsite restaurant and their complimentary breakfast buffet is just wonderful. Their front desk personnel could take a class on how to smile and how to handle guests in a pleasant manner. Their other staff is just wonderful and very helpful and friendly. Can't say enough about them. Parking is a bit tight, but they make it work. For being so close to LAX, it is amazingly quiet. Overall, very comfortable and very reasonable in price. I will stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful all round experience”
Reviews.Author: pianotea
Reviews.Content: A very friendly hotel with shuttle service from the airport. Lovely suite with extremely comfortable bed. Wonderful breakfast in the atrium with food made to order. Complimentary nightly happy hour in a warm and friendly room. Would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bojangs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just one night on a return trip from Hawaii. I had told them we would be late in arriving about 9 pm. They said this would not be a problem. They also said a shuttle would pick us up. We waited for one hour on the shuttle so we called again, they finally picked us up. When we arrived at the hotel they stuck us in a corner room dark and very noisy. When I complained they said we arrived late. I told them when I made the reservation they said this would be okay. She told me to take it up with reservations. I will think twice before staying in Embassy Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for early morning departure!”
Reviews.Author: teash
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night on a business trip. The rooms at this Embassy Suites were very nice. Extremely large and well appointed accomodations. Complimentary bottled water for frequent traveler guests. Small, but nice exercise room. No free internet here. The staff provided a box breakfast since I had an early morning flight and would miss the free buffet. Great happy hour at this hotel. Clean rooms. Free shuttle to airport running every 1/2 hour starting at 4 am. Super convenient and within walking distance of numerous rental car locations. Reasonable corporate rate. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant business hotel”
Reviews.Author: CFIT
Reviews.Content: Our committee stayed at Embassy Suites North LAX a single night in October '06. We used the hotel's meeting facilities. The parking entrance was a bit hard to find. It is a narrow turn-in with a small sign on the north side of Airport St. Once I figured this out, parking was no problem. The desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. They let me check in a noon. My room was fine. Much more space than I am used to having in a business hotel. I like hotels with atriums and glass elevators, so this was good for me. Our meeting group paid for wireless access for our members. The network was fast with no hiccups. Bed was comfortable. Sheets and comforter were clean. Complimentary soap, shampoo, etc by Neutrogena. Conference snack of cookies was good. Mexican food provided for dinner as merely ok. Breakfast for our group (not the complimentary one) was very good. I try to take stairs whenever possible, but you cannot go from an upper level to ground floor without setting off an alarm. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Merrilee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites to avoid the morning rush hour as we had an early flight from LAX. The reservation staff was very efficient and check-in was also a breeze. The hotel was very clean and surprisingly quiet. The room was large and comfortable. It is a great place to stay and an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for $$”
Reviews.Author: bayview6
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate on a week-end stay. The rooms are suites and the interior furnishings are rather new and up-scale. Had to pay for internet connection and parking. My room was on the 2nd floor on the Airporter Rd so the outside noise was present but didn't interfere with sleep. Liked the atrium set-up and the free hot breakfast was very good. Had a couple of drinks at the Manager's reception. Dinner food was fine. The LAX location was pleasant even though we had to go downtown. We walked down Century Blvd at night with its colorful lights and palm trees. There are some fast food places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: filam2004
Reviews.Content: Overall I find the Embassy Suites North very nice and very comfortable. The evening manager's get together is nice and the breakfast is excellent, if your flight is not at 7 AM or earlier. With high security at the airport most guest have to be at the airport at least 2 hours early so most guest cannot use the free breakfast service, although the coffee, fruit, juice, and pastries become available around 5:30 AM. The only disappointment is they charge for hgh speed internet when surrounding hotels supply high speed internet access for free. I just pull up to the window and use my wireless to access the Four Points Sheraton accross the street. There is also free free Wi-Fi in the area around the hotel so why do they charge their guests?

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: slave
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a nights stay at this hotel. On arrival at LAX aiport I was informed by the hotel that the transport shuttle was not available, so take a taxi and they would re-imburse us. Obviously that did not take into account the gratuity that we had to pay the taxi driver. When we arrived at the hotel we were given a room with one double bed, when I had clearly booked a room with 2 double beds due to the fact that I had a 13 and 15 year old with us. When we got to the room it was clearly a smoking room and very tatty.(I had also booked a non smoking room). After a lot of discussion with the hotel they gave us another room which also was a smoking room, we had to leave the air conditioning off to help get rid of the smell. The hotel had no outdoor pool. The waitress dropped my husbands meal on the floor at the evening meal. Therefore his meal came much later than ours. The comlimentary breakfast was the worst I have had. I would suggest that they give this hotel a major overall. I am glad we only had to spend the night there. I have stayed in embassy suites before and they are not all like this one.
